title: okinawa_de_suki_ni_natta_ko_ga_hougen_sugite_tsurasugiru
body:
Okitsura is a school romcom manga by Sora Egumi (空えぐみ). The male protagonist, [[Nakamura Teruaki]], transfers from Tokyo to a school in Okinawa and falls in love with the local girl [[Kyan Hina]]. Only problem is, he doesn't get what she's saying in her [[Okinawa|Okinawan]] dialect!

h4.Characters

h5.Main characters

* [[Nakamura Teruaki]]
* [[Kyan Hina]]
* [[Higa Kana]]

h5.Minor/supporting characters

* [[Agena Yae]]
* [[Shimoji Isao]]
* [[Uema Tensuke]]
* [[Higa Suzu]]
* [[Higa Tetsu]]

h4.External links

* "Anime official website (jpn)":https://okitsura.com/
* "Anime official X (jpn)":https://x.com/okitsura
* "Wikipedia (eng): Okitsura: Fell in Love with an Okinawan Girl, but I Just Wish I Knew What She's Saying":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Okitsura
* "Wikipedia (jpn)":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%B2%96%E7%B8%84%E3%81%A7%E5%A5%BD%E3%81%8D%E3%81%AB%E3%81%AA%E3%81%A3%E3%81%9F%E5%AD%90%E3%81%8C%E6%96%B9%E8%A8%80%E3%81%99%E3%81%8E%E3%81%A6%E3%83%84%E3%83%A9%E3%81%99%E3%81%8E%E3%82%8B

title: koumajou_densetsu_2
body:
Sequel to [[Koumajou Densetsu 1]] and second game in the [[Koumajou Densetsu]] series. Popularly known as Touhouvania 2, it was remastered for Steam and Nintendo Switch in 2023 as Koumajou Remilia II: Stranger's Requiem. 

It introduces characters from [[Touhou]] Youyoumu: [[Perfect Cherry Blossom]], as well as some others from later titles. Well known for being fully voiced by a professional cast.

h4. Characters
[tn]Marked [b]Ph[/b] are bosses in Phantasm mode.[/tn]
* Main Character: [[Izayoi Sakuya]] [tn](Voiced by [[Sawashiro Miyuki]])[/tn]
* Boss (Stage 1): [[Alice Margatroid]] [tn](Voiced by [[Tomatsu Haruka]])
* Boss (Stage 2/Ph): [[Chen]] [tn](Voiced by [[Shintani Ryouko]])
* Boss (Stage 3): [[Konpaku Youmu]] [tn](Voiced by [[Hirohashi Ryou]])
* Boss (Stage 4): [[Kirisame Marisa]] [tn](Voiced by [[Shintani Ryouko]])
* Boss (Stage 5): [[Hakurei Reimu]] [tn](Voiced by [[Satou Rina]])
* Boss (Stage 6/Ph): [[Yakumo Ran]] [tn](Voiced by [[Kobayashi Yuu]])
* Boss (Stage 7): [[Saigyouji Yuyuko]] [tn](Voiced by [[Shiina Hekiru]])
* Boss (Stage 8/Ph): [[Yakumo Yukari]] [tn](Voiced by [[Endou Aya]])
* Boss (Stage 8): [[Remilia Scarlet]] [tn](Voiced by [[Kitamura Eri]])
* Midboss (Stage Ph): [[Sunny Milk]] [tn](Voiced by Kitamura Eri)
* Midboss (Stage Ph): [[Luna Child]] [tn](Voiced by Rikimaru Noriko)
* Midboss (Stage Ph): [[Star Sapphire]] [tn](Voiced by Hisako Kanemoto)
* Support: [[Onozuka Komachi]] [tn](Voiced by [[Tomatsu Haruka]])
* Support: [[Patchouli Knowledge]] [tn](Voiced by [[Rikimaru Noriko]])
* Support: [[Flandre Scarlet]] [tn](Voiced by [[Kanemoto Hisako]])
* Support: [[Hong Meiling]] [tn](Voiced by [[Satou Satomi]])

h4. External links

title: callie_(octo_idol_outfit)_(splatoon)
body:
[[Official alternate costume]] attributed to [[Callie (splatoon)|]] from the [[Splatoon (series)|]] series. It was introduced in [[Splatoon 2]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #8827502

h4. Common community nicknames
h5. Japanese
* [i]Takori-Chan[/i] - A combination of [i]Tako[/i] (meaning "Octopus") and [i]"Aori"[i], being Callie's Japanese name.
* [i]TakoochiAori[/i] - Meaning [i]"Octopus fallen Callie"[/i].

h5. English
* [i]Octo Callie[/i] - Referring to her current allegiance while she's wearing the outfit.
* [i]Hypno Callie / Brainwashed Callie[/i] - Referring to how she's not entirely herself while wearing the outfit (or at least the shades).
* [i]Evil Callie / Boss Callie[/i] - Simply referring to her current role in the game's narrative.

title: machi_komacine
body:
Character from [[Hunter x Hunter]]

The member #3 of the [i]Phantom Troupe[/i]. Machi is one of the coldest members in the Phantom Troupe, almost never losing her cool or displaying any feelings. Machi is fiercely loyal to [[Chrollo Lucilfer]], going so far as to challenge two other members of the Troupe for his sake; moreover, she stated that she would hunt [[Hisoka Morow]] down if he were to kill Chrollo. She is very confident in her strength, and if threatened, she replies accordingly.

h4. Appearance

Machi is a short young woman with a petite build. She has [[pink hair|pink]], [[messy hair|messy]], [[medium hair|mid-back hair]] that is usually tied into a [[wide ponytail]], and [[blue eyes]]. She is one of the few Phantom Troupe members that prefers to wear traditional [[japanese clothes|japanese-style clothing]]. She looks like a modern day [[ninja|kunoichi]]. Her usual outfit consists of [[bike_shorts]] matched with a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] uwagi, an [[obi]] worn around her waist and an [[obijime]] is tied over it, a pair of [[fingerless gloves]] with a [[pincushion]], [[tabi]] boots or [[socks]] with [[zouri]], and [[leg warmers]] that cover from the ankles up to her knees.

In the 1999 anime adaptation, her hair is [[purple hair|dark purple]] and her eyes are [[yellow eyes|gold]].

title: angelina_(nikke)
body:
A character from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]].

[[N102 (nikke)|Anne]]'s biological mother. Currently a 45-year old single mother. [spoiler]When Anne was diagnosed with a neurodegenerative disease, Angelina submitted her daughter to become a Nikke, hoping the process would cure her disease. As a result of the medical expenses incurred keeping her daughter's health stable, Angelina tries to work different jobs in order to pay for Anne's memory wipes. However, it appears that the periodic memory wipes necessary to save her life are not improving her condition at all.[/spoiler]

She has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] tied [[hair over shoulder|over her shoulder]] with [[blue eyes]]. Her outfit consists of a [[red shirt]] with [[bowtie]] and a long [[brown skirt]]. She carries a [[purse]] along with a brown [[notebook]] with her, similarly to her daughter.

title: koumajou_densetsu_1
body:
紅魔城伝説 緋色の交響曲 (Koumajou Densetsu: Akeiro no Koukyoukyoku), lit. Legend of Scarlet Devil Castle: Scarlet Symphony. Often referred to as Touhouvania. Also known by the full name of Koumajou Densetsu 1: Scarlet Symphony. 

The first game of the [[Koumajou Densetsu]] series, was later remastered for Steam and Nintendo Switch in 2022, titled Koumajou Remilia: Scarlet Symphony.

It received a sequel titled [[Koumajou Densetsu 2]].

h4. Characters

title: twitter_strip_game
body:
A [[Twitter]] art challenge where an artist draws a character and then removes an article of clothing each time a certain number of likes, retweets, or votes is achieved. Originally created by [[Scott Malin]] in June 2021, the format went viral as an art challenge on Twitter in 2022 and beyond.

Many different varieties of the format developed following the original challenge. This tag includes any variety of the format, includes parodies of the trend, giving the character more clothes, changing outfits, or doing other things besides stripping.

In February 2025 a new variant called the [[Twitter cutting game]] emerged, which involves cutting off parts of the character's clothing.

Not to be confused with a [[strip game]], which is where a group of characters play a game with each other and strip as a penalty.

h4. Examples

* !asset #10537201: Origin
* !post #6221885
* !post #8813748: [[Twitter cutting game]]

h4. See also

* [[like and retweet]]
* [[Reverse strip game]]
* [[Twitter strip game parody]]
* [[Twitter cutting game]]

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Twitter Strip Game":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/twitter-strip-game

Like a [[twitter strip game]], except played in reverse, i.e. engagement is traded for putting more clothes on rather than taking them off.

title: x-men:_the_last_stand
body: X-Men: The Last Stand (also marketed as X3: The Last Stand, or X-Men 3) is a 2006 superhero film based on the [[X-Men]] comic books published by Marvel Entertainment Group.It is the sequel to [[X2 (2003)]], as well as the third installment in the [[X-Men film series]], and was directed by Brett Ratner. It features an ensemble cast including [[Hugh Jackman]], [[Halle Berry]], [[Ian McKellen]], Famke Janssen, Anna Paquin, Kelsey Grammer, Vinnie Jones, and [[Patrick Stewart]]. The film is loosely based on two X-Men comic book story arcs, "Gifted" and "The Dark Phoenix Saga", with a plot that revolves around a "mutant cure" that causes serious repercussions among mutants and humans, and on the resurrection of [[Jean Grey]] who unleashes a dark force.
other_names: X-MEN:ファイナルディシジョン

title: yoshida_yuuko_(machikado_mazoku)
body:
Titular character of the anime/manga series [[Machikado Mazoku]]. She is a newly awakened [[demon girl]] with [[brown eyes]] and [[brown hair]] (red in the anime) along with [[horns]] and a [[demon tail]].

Her demonic alias is '[b]Shadow Mistress Yuuko[/b]' (シャドウミストレス優子), shortened by others to [b]Shamiko[/b] (シャミ子).  
Similar to magical girls, she can magically transform into a revealing [[Crisis Management Form (machikado Mazoku)|Crisis Management Form]] costume to enhance her abilities.
other_names: 吉田優子/シャミ子/吉田良子

title: crisis_management_form_(machikado_mazoku)
body: [[Yoshida Yuuko (Machikado Mazoku)|Shamiko]]'s signature [[bikini armor]] outfit, also worn by [[Lilith (Machikado Mazoku)|Lilith]], or depictions of her shouting "Crisis management!!" to transform into it.

title: shiroko_(young)_(blue_archive)
body:

title: uniboob
body:
Characters with one breast in the middle of their chest, or two [[breasts]] drawn in such a way that they do not appear as separate breasts.

Not to be confused with [[single breast]]

title: single_breast
body:
A character with a single breast. May also have a visible [[mastectomy scar]].

Not to be confused with [[uniboob]].

title: nostalgia_(idolmaster)
body:
Nostalgia is an [i][[Idolmaster]][/i] song performed by [[Hoshii Miki]]. "Nostalgia first appeared as a downloadable song for THE iDOLM@STER ONE FOR ALL. This song is choreographed to be a solo dance, which can only be performed by Hoshii Miki. " [1]

h4. Links

[1] "iM@S Wiki entry":http://www.project-imas.wiki/Nostalgia

title: tumblestone
body:
An item in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon legends: arceus|Legends: Arceus]][/i]. It is used with an [[Apricorn]] to craft [[Hisuian Poke Ball|Poké Balls]].

The Tumblestone is a rounded triangular stone.

h4. External links

* "Bulbapedia: Tumblestone":[https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Tumblestone]

title: hisuian_poke_ball
body:
An older type of [[Poke Ball|Poké Ball]] used in [[pokemon legends: arceus|Pokémon Legends: Arceus]]. Official art: post #4381954

[quote]
The early Poké Balls were different from what we know now, made mostly of wood and steam puffed from their tops when Pokémon were caught.
[/quote]

Source: https://twitter.com/NintendoAmerica/status/1365352521598832644

title: shrek_the_third
body: The third movie in the [[Shrek (series)|]] film series.

title: shrek_1
body: The first movie in the [[Shrek (series)|]] film series.

title: shrek_(series)
body:
A series of 3D animated films developed by [[Dreamworks]] Studios in the early 2000s. The movies focus on the troubles of the [[Shrek|titular]] [[ogre]] and his companions while parodying children's fairy tales, especially [[Disney]]'s adaptations. In the mid-late 2010s, [i]Shrek[/i] would see resurgence as a recurring internet [[meme]].

h4. Movies

* [[Shrek 1]]
* [[Shrek 2]]
* [[Shrek the Third]]
* [[Shrek Forever After]]
* [[Shrek 5]]
* Puss in Boots
** [[Puss in Boots: The Last Wish]]

title: shiroko_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Field captain of the [[Foreclosure Task Force (blue archive)|]].

Her full name is Sunaookami Shiroko.

Uses a [[SIG 556]] [[assault rifle]] with a [[sig p220/p226|SIG P226]] as a sidearm.

Voiced by: [[Ogura Yui]]
Original artist: [[hwansang]]

h4. Appearance

title: id_:_invaded
body:
[b]ID:INVADED[/b] is a Winter 2020 original anime series by NAZ that is directed by Ei Aoki and written by Ōtarō Maijō.

This tag is written as [code]id_:_invaded[/code] due to a technical restriction where tags cannot begin with [code]id:[/code].

h4. External links

* "Official Website":https://id-invaded-anime.com/
other_names: イド:インヴェイデッド

title: genthru
body:
A character from [[Hunter x Hunter]]. He is the main antagonist of Greed Island arc.

A founding member of a group of Greed Island players who are recruiting other players to complete the game. In secret, Genthru is actually the infamous [b]Bomber[/b], a murderous player who use explosive Nen abilities in order to blackmail and kill other players for their cards.

h4.Appearance
Genthru in a [[skinny]] tall man who wears a [[sunglasses]]. He wears a [[white coat]], [[blue capelet]] tied around his neck.

title: pale_color
body:
Images whose colors are very pale, as if the image was mixed with white. Pale color are very low in contrast. 

Related to [[muted color]], where color is washed out to nearly [[monochrome]] levels, usually with grey.  [[Dark]] is the opposite of this, where colors are all nearly black.

[spoiler]It also enables him, [[Ultraman Dyna]], and [[Ultraman Cosmos]] to fuse their powers to transform into [[Ultraman Saga]].[/spoiler]

title: fuuka_academy_school_uniform
body:
The [[school uniform]] worn by the students at Fuuka Academy in [[my-hime|My-HiME]].

The [b]high school[/b] uniform has a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[orange jacket]] for the [[winter uniform]], and an [[orange vest]] for the [[summer uniform]]. Both version has a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] underneath, worn together with a [[brown skirt|brown]] [[miniskirt]].
The [b]middle school[/b] uniform is basically a modified [[serafuku]] composed of a [[white shirt|white]] [[sailor shirt]] with a [[blue sailor collar]] and a [[blue skirt|blue]], [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]].


[b]Example[/b]
* !post #9044019: Girls' summer uniform (middle school version to the far left, high school version to the right)

h4.See also
* [[List of uniforms]]

title: love_live!_nijigasaki_high_school_idol_club_the_movie_-_finale
body:
A trilogy of theatrical movie follow-ups to the [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]] anime, featuring the girls participating in the School Idol Grand Prix, a tournament for solo school idols. Each movie has made a departure from the art style set in the anime prior.

The first part follows [[Uehara Ayumu]], [[Nakasu Kasumi]], [[Osaka Shizuku]], [[Konoe Kanata]], [[Emma Verde]], and [[Zhong Lanzhu]] in [[Okinawa]]. Its animation and art direction is handled by [[Kerorira]].

The second part features [[Miyashita Ai]], [[Yuki Setsuna]], [[Asaka Karin]], [[Tennoji Rina]], [[Mifune Shioriko]], and [[Mia Taylor]] in [[Osaka (city)|]].

h4. New characters
h6. Chapter 1

* [[Ishimine Koito]]
* [[Zhong Lanzhu's mother]]

* [[PHOENIX (love live!)|]]
* [[Rise Up High! (love live!)|]]
* [[Stellar Stream (love live!)|]]

title: zwei_association_south_(identity)_(project_moon)
body:
[[list of project moon Identities|Identities]] of [[Limbus Company]] Sinners extracted from mirror worlds where they joined the Zwei Association, the 2nd Association of the city specializing in protection, in its Southern Branch.

They wear civilian clothing of their choosing while working undercover.

In battle, they wear outfits similar to riot gear with [[blue coat|blue coats]] with [[shoulder armor]] over a [[black vest]] and [[black pants]]. Some members of this faction use [[baton (weapon)|batons]] instead of swords.

h4. Playable Identities:

title: it's_over_9000_(meme)
body:
An [[meme|internet meme]] born out of the English Ocean dub of [[Dragon Ball Z]], where [[Vegeta]] scans [[Son Goku|Goku's]] power level with his [[scouter]]. Shocked by the result, Vegeta breaks his scouter with his hand and yells [i][b]"It's Over 9000!"[/b][/i].

However, Goku's power scale in English dub is mistranslated from the original version, as the result was 8000 instead of 9000.

h4. External links

* "Dragon Ball Wiki":[http://dragonball.wikia.com/wiki/It's_Over_9000!]
* "Know Your Meme":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/its-over-9000]
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/It%27s_Over_9000!]

title: knitting
body:
A hobby where [[yarn]] is thread together to create cloth by making little loops called stitches on a row, and then threading the yarn through these stitches on the next row while creating stitches for the next row, and so forth. Discernable from similar crafts by the use of two (or more) [[knitting needle]]s or a knitting machine. Knitted [[sweater]]s and [[scarf|scarves]] are made with this process.

h4. See also

* [[Knitting needle]]
* [[yarn]]
* [[crochet]]
* [[naalbinding]]

title: rosario+vampire
body:
A manga series by [[Ikeda Akihisa]]. It was originally published in [i]Monthly Shonen Jump[/i]; when that magazine ended, the manga moved to [i]Jump Square[/i] where it continues as "ロザリオとバンパイアseasonII" ("Rosario + Vampire Season II" in the English release). It was adapted into two seasons of anime in 2008.

[[Aono Tsukune]]'s parents were overjoyed when they found Youkai Academy, a high school that would accept him despite his lousy test scores. What they didn't know was that it was a school for monsters trying to fit into human society.

Tsukune quickly fell in love with [[Akashiya Moka]], the prettiest girl in school, and discovered that he has the ability to remove her [[cross_necklace|rosario]], unsealing her vampiric powers and allowing her to kick the crap out of the perverts and delinquents that come after them.

h4. Characters

title: starcraft
body:
[b]StarCraft[/b] is a [[military]] [[science fiction]] themed RTS (Real Time Strategy) point-and-click computer [[video game]] developed by [[blizzard entertainment|Blizzard Entertainment]] and released in 1998. 

The game is set in the 25-26th century revolving around three major races: Terrans, Zerg and Protoss. The expansion, [b]Brood War[/b], is merged together with this tag.

title: mami_mogu_mogu
body:
Posts with explicit reference to [spoiler]the death scene of [[Tomoe Mami]][/spoiler] in Episode 3 of [i][[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]][/i].

[spoiler]The scene involves an apparently victorious Mami having her head chomped and [[decapitation|decapitated]] by the [[witch (madoka magica)|]] [[Charlotte_(madoka_magica)|]]'s true form. This scene acts as a plot twist due to the first two episodes depicts a typical lighthearted magical girl story tones, whereas the rest of the story would gradually turn into a gritty dark fantasy.[/spoiler]

The general depictions are:

* [spoiler]A body hanging in the air with the head out of frame.[/spoiler]
* [spoiler][[Charlotte_(madoka_magica)|]]'s mouth is wide open, ready to chomp somebody.[/spoiler]
* [spoiler][[Tomoe Mami|Mami]] loses or having lost her head, one way or another.[/spoiler]

This tag is loosely translated into [spoiler]"Mami chomp"[/spoiler], with "mogu mogu" as the onomatopoeia for [spoiler]chewing.[/spoiler] The name came from the runes appeared during "Charlotte's labyrinth scene":https://images.puella-magi.net/8/86/Episode_3_runes.jpg.

Because of the nature of this tag, please add the {{spoilers}} tag as appropriate.

The related Japanese terms are:

* マミる (Mami-ru, to be Mami'd)
** Nicopedia article: http://dic.nicovideo.jp/id/4557586 
** Verbs of this form may be transitive or intransitive; e.g. 取る is transitive and 判る is intransitive.  Both of the Japanese wiki articles cited indicate that マミる is an intransitive verb.
* マミられる (Mami-rareru, to be Mami'd; alternate & much less common version)
* マミった (Mami-tta, has been Mami'd; past tense of Mamiru)

title: donkey_kong
body:
The title character and main villain of the arcade game [[Donkey Kong (1981 Game)|]], an early arcade hit for [[Nintendo]].

[[Mario]] has to fend off his barrels to rescue [[Pauline (Mario)|]].

In later games he became a hero, such as in [[Donkey Kong Country]], and is a reoccurring character in the [[Mario (series)|Mario]] spinoff games.

title: megurine_luka
body:
A [[Vocaloid]] released for the VOCALOID2 engine. She was the third of the Character Vocal Series and is an official [[Piapro Studio|PIAPRO]] character.

She is voiced by [[Asakawa Yuu]]. Her appearance was illustrated by [[Kei (Keigarou)|KEI]].  She has [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. She wears a black top, a [[side slit]] [[long skirt]] and [[black thighhighs]], her [[boots]] are golden, and she has a [[single detached sleeve]] on her right arm and also a golden [[headset]]. She also has a golden [[chest jewel]] in shape of a [[trumpet]]'s [[valve|valves]] and the [[infinity symbol]].

title: turbo_granny_(dandandan)
body: The Turbo-Granny, a character of the manga series [[Dandadan]], is a well-known yokai that was previously within a tunnel located at Shono City until her confrontation with [[Ayase Momo]] and [[Takakura Ken (Dandadan)|]]. After having her powers sealed within [[Takakura Ken (Dandadan)|]], along with her consciousness being trapped inside a stuffed cat doll, the Turbo-Granny makes a deal with [[Ayase Momo]] to help [[Takakura Ken (Dandadan)|]] find his kintama in exchange for having her powers back.

title: wrestling_ring
body:
A square-shaped, raised platform covered in canvas and surrounded on each side  by three taut [[rope]]s, in which professional [[wrestling]] matches are staged.  Distinguished from a [[boxing ring]] in that most boxing rings have a fourth rope.

Sizes can vary, but most wrestling rings are between 18-20 feet (approximately 5.5-6 meters) along each side.

title: kitasan_black_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]Kanmei "Kitasan" + "Black" from his sire name.[/tn]
Japanese [[horse|racehorse]]. Sired by [[Black Tide (racehorse)|]] (a full brother to [[Deep Impact (racehorse)|]]) and foaled by Sugar Heart (from Sakura Bakushin O).

He is a bay horse with a star and stripe marking as well as a pastern on his left back leg. He is known for being unusually big, weighing around 530-540 kg at his prime, being one of the heaviest racehorses of his caliber.

This front-running prodigy with a pedigree that just implies that he won at the genetic lottery is Black Tide's most successful progeny by leagues thanks to his 7 G1 victories.

He is the sire of [[Equinox (racehorse)|]] (All-around genius with 6 consecutive G1 victories), [[Sol Oriens (racehorse)|]] (His first winner of a classic race), [[Wilson Tesoro (racehorse)|]] (His first winner of a dirt G1) and [[Croix du Nord (racehorse)|]] (His first winner of a G1 race for 2-year-olds).

He is also the sire of [[Gaia Force (racehorse)|]] (All-terrain meme horse), [[Skilfing (racehorse)|]] (Aoba-sho winner [spoiler]who is more known for dying at the Japanese Derby[/spoiler]) and [[Piko Chan Black (racehorse)|]] (Winner of the 2025 Spring Stakes, a race Kitasan Black and Black Tide previously won.) among others.

title: catjam_(meme)
body:
[b]CatJAM[/b] is a BetterTTV custom Twitch emote of a white cat rhythmically bobbing its head as if to the beat of a song. Originating from a viral video, the emote gained major success on Twitch after being enabled by multiple popular streamers, later gaining popularity as source material for memes in which the cat "vibes" to various music. The cat is also known as [b]Vibing Cat[/b].

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: CatJAM":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/catjam-vibing-cat]

title: coat
body:
A long garment worn for warmth, protection or fashion. Coats are made from thick material, therefore they have weight.

Coats are longer than [[jacket]]s. A jacket goes to the waist or hip. A coat goes down to thighs or past that.

They often feature [[lapels]].

title: sukajan
body:
A [[jacket]] in the style of a [[bomber jacket]] or [[letterman jacket]] with [[embroidery]] on the back and chest, often of fancy eastern-themed designs such as [[eastern dragon]]s, [[tiger]]s, [[cherry blossoms]], etc.

The sukajan has its origins in post-[[World War II]], where occupying American soldiers in Japan would commemorate their time overseas by ordering custom-made jackets with these oriental designs. For this reason, these jackets are also known as souvenir jackets.

Often seen worn by [[delinquent]]s, the [[yakuza]], or [[band (music)|]] members.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Sukajan":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sukajan

body:
An [[original]] character interacting with a canon character from a franchise, especially when romantically and/or sexually paired together. Especially prevalent with images with [[commissioner insert|commissioner]] or [[artist self-insert|artist]] inserted.

Custom playable characters from games such as the [[Mirai Senshi]] or [[Tav (baldur's gate)|]] count as original characters.

Unnamed or [[faceless]] characters don't count.

title: graph
body:
A graph is a visualization of numerical data. Examples include line graphs, scatter plots, [[bar chart]]s, [[radar chart]]s, [[pie chart]]s etc.

When a graph makes use of two or three axis at right angles to one another (often with a [[grid]]), it is a [[Cartesian chart]].  Line graphs and scatter plots are examples of these.

Not to be confused with [[chart]], which is generally for comparison charts between characters.

h4. Examples

* !post #8619592: [[Bar chart]]

title: sakaguchi_ango
body:
A [[Bungou Stray Dogs]] character, based off the real-life essayist Ango Sakaguchi (1906-1955). 

He is portrayed with [[black hair]], [[grey eyes]], and [[glasses]]; his outfit consists of a grey-theme [[formal clothes|formal attire]]: [[grey jacket]], [[white shirt]], [[blue necktie]], [[grey pants]], and [[black shoes]]. 

In real life, he was often grouped with [[Dazai Osamu (bungou stray dogs)|]] and [[Oda Sakunosuke (bungou stray dogs)|]] as the [b]Buraiha[/b], the "Decadent Authors" of post-World War II Japanese literature.

body:
A sleeveless vest/jacket that tapers out over the shoulders, typically worn over a [[kimono]] with a [[hakama]] as part of the traditional [[Japanese clothes|Japanese men's outfit]] known as [i]kamishimo[/i] (lit. upper & lower).

A similar vest/jacket without tapering shoulders and typically worn over [[Japanese armor|armor]] is called [[jinbaori]].

title: dizzy_(guilty_gear)
body:
Dizzy is a character from the [[Guilty Gear]] series and the final boss of the second game in the series, [i]Guilty Gear X[/i].

She is the daughter of [[Justice (guilty gear)|]] and an unknown human. She is not fully able to control her Gear powers, and her [[wings]] can transform (into [[Undine (guilty gear)|]] and [[Necro_(guilty_gear)|]]) and fight for her, against her will if necessary. After being hunted relentlessly by the Post-War Administration Bureau, which fears her power, she has found a haven on the Mayship, with the Jellyfish Pirates.

By [[Guilty Gear 2]], she is married to [[Ky Kiske]] and has given birth to a son, [[Sin Kiske]]. During the events of [[Guilty Gear Xrd]]'s Revelator story line, it is revealed that [spoiler][[Sol Badguy]] and [[Jack-O' Valentine]] are her parents.[/spoiler] At the end of Guilty Gear Strive Another Story DLC, Dizzy would become [[Queen Dizzy]].

title: yakub
body:
According the [[Nation of Islam]]'s doctrine, Yakub was a black scientist who lived in [[Mecca]] 6,600 years ago.

Notorious for his large head and arrogance, after discovering the law of attraction and repulsion at age 6, he devised a plan to create a new race that could rule over all others through trickeries and lies, or "Attraction" He accomplished this through a selective breeding project. With 59,999 followers, he traveled to an isle of Pelan, in the Aegean Sea, enacting absolute rule and deliberate eugenics upon a population. 

While he died at age 150, his followers continued his work and successfully created the white race after 600 years.

This new race traveled to Mecca and caused so much trouble they were banished to West Asia, now known as Europe, stripped of everything but their language. Living as relative savages for thousands of years, Moses attempted to civilize them, teaching them to wear clothes, but failed, and used dynamite to kill the most troublesome among them.

Despite this they did, ultimately, learn Yakub's principles of "Trickonology," through which they soon managed to enslave the other races through their lack of empathy. This would continue from the age of exploration until the "Black" races (Which according to NOI doctrine, included East Asian and Middle Eastern races) regained dominance, a process which began in 1914 

This story is (obviously) fake, but it is meant to be interpreted symbolically. Its insistence that white people used to live as "Savages", for example may be an exaggeration of the idea that many European civilization emerged later than African, Asian, Arab, and Native American ones (Excluding Greece and Rome/Italy, who were not considered "White" as of the early 1900s, when this was conceived). Or it may simply exist to counter the notion that non-white peoples were "Backwards" until they were encountered by Europeans during the age of exploration.

Moses' attempt to "Civilize" white people may also reference the idea that many ideas that Europeans learned were imparted to them by distant African and Arabic civilizations, such as the bare ideas of vaccination and (allegedly) bathing.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Yakub (Nation of Islam)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yakub_(Nation_of_Islam)]

title: getter_dragon
body:
The second iteration of the [[Getter-1]] form. Dragon is a larger, and more powerful mecha, with a powerful head mounted getter beam, the twin tomahawk boomerang attack, and the powerful [[shine spark]]. 
[spoiler]During the mid part of [[Shin Getter Robo]], it was buried in the ground after [[Kuruma Benkei]] fought off the assault of the ressurected King Burai. It began to metamorphose into something [[Shin Getter Dragon|else]] while underground, driving Professor Saotome more insane, as well as causing the ghosts of old enemies to appear.[/spoiler]

title: noah_(d.gray-man)
body:
Noahs or the Clan Of Noah are a Faction in the D.Gray-Man series

They are descendants of the survivors of the destruction of the previous world who repopulated the new world after the new world was formed. They serve as the main antagonists Faction in the D.Gray-Man series as they desire to destroy Innocence, and also destroy the new world and kill its people as revenge for the destruction of their world.

Members of this Faction are recognizable from normal humans with their grey/dark skin, the stigmata mark on their forehead and yellow eyes. However they can also assume the appearance of a normal human if they want to which allows them to blend among normal humans pretty easily

title: donkey_kong_jr.
body:
The son of the arcade-era [[Donkey Kong]]. He wears a [[white leotard]] that has the letter "J" on it. 

He stars in [i][[Donkey Kong Jr._(game)|Donkey Kong Jr.]][/i], where he must save his imprisoned father from the clutches of [[Mario]]. In [i][[Donkey Kong (Game Boy)]][/i] he assists his father in the kidnapping of [[Pauline_(mario)|Pauline]] and attempts to impede Mario's attempts to rescue her. Some of his last major appearances were being playable in [i][[Super Mario Kart]][/i] for the [[Super Nintendo]], [i][[Mario's Tennis]][/i] for the [[Virtual Boy]] and [i][[Mario Tennis (Nintendo 64)|]][/i] for the [[Nintendo 64]].

Outside of the occasional retro throwback or cameo, he's been largely replaced by [[Diddy Kong]].

title: honda_civic
body:
The Honda Civic is a series of [[car]]s manufactured by [[Honda]] since 1972.

Since 2000, the Civic has been categorized as a compact car, while previously it occupied the subcompact class. As of 2021, the Civic is positioned between the [[Honda Fit]]/[[Honda City]] and [[Honda Accord]] in Honda's global car lineup.

title: renault_sport_rs_01
body:
The Renault Sport R.S. 01 is a sports racing car manufactured by Renault Sport, the performance division of French automaker [[Renault]]. It was originally built to compete in the Renault Sport Trophy, the company's one-make racing series, serving as a replacement for the [[Renault Megane|Renault Mégane]] Trophy. The car was later homologated for Group GT3 by the SRO Motorsports Group for the car to be able to compete in GT3 class racing series.

The Trophy-spec R.S. 01 is the most powerful one-make racer built by Renault (albeit using the V6 engine from the [[Nissan GT-R]]), and also the only race car not based on a production car.

h4. External Links
* "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Renault_Sport_R.S._01

title: mudrock_(arknights)
body:
[i]Mudrock, Sarkaz mercenary, old friend of the fertile soil and stone.[/i]

A playable Defender Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Kazdel[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]September 21[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Sarkaz[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]163 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]4 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

Formerly a part of the Reunion Movement, Mudrock led her team far from Ursus after disagreements with the organization. She had no involvement with Reunion whatsoever during the incidents in Chernobog and Lungmen. Searching for a foothold to establish, Mudrock took her team towards Leithania. After taking in a great number of Leithanien Infected there, Mudrock became a highly esteemed leader, and her team came to be known as the [i]Mudrock Squad[/i].

Despite Mudrock's multiple attempts to avoid conflict with other powers, her side was nevertheless drawn into constant disputes. So as to prevent any further meaningless sacrifice, she headed to Kazdel and after coming into contact with an elite operator named Logos, she departed for Rhodes Island.

She and her squad are antagonists of the side story event [i]Twilight of Wolumonde[/i].

Uses a [[sledgehammer]]-styled [[war hammer]] during combat. Her [[voice actor]] is [[Uchida Maaya]].

h4. Skins

* !post #4179711: Default
* !post #4179712: [[mudrock_(elite_ii)_(arknights)|Elite II]]
* !post #4679495: [[mudrock_(silent_night)_(arknights)|Silent Night]]
* !post #5438893: [[mudrock_(obsidian)_(arknights)|Obsidian]]
* !post #8712642: [[mudrock_(rubble)_(arknights)|Rubble]]

title: the_simpsons
body:
A very popular and long lasting animated comedy TV show created by cartoonist Matthew Groening. The series is a satirical depiction of [[united_states|American]] life.

Since its debut on December 17, 1989, over 700 episodes of the show have been broadcast. It is the longest-running American animated series, longest-running American sitcom, and the longest-running American scripted primetime television series, both in terms of seasons and number of episodes.

For works done in the style of The Simpsons, tag as [[matt groening (style)]].

title: eirika_(fire_emblem)
body:
Character from [[Fire Emblem: The Sacred Stones]], one of the game's main characters and protagonists. [[Ephraim (Fire Emblem)|Ephraim]] is her older twin brother. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[aqua hair]], and [[aqua eyes|aqua]] or [[blue eyes]], her usual outfit includes a [[red shirt]] with [[short sleeves]], [[breastplate]], [[shoulder armor]], [[red gloves|red]] [[fingerless gloves]], [[earrings]], [[red footwear|red]] [[red thighhighs|thigh]] [[thigh boots|boots]] and a [[white skirt|white]] [[miniskirt]]. Her skirt in particular is noteworthy for being the topic of conversation which actually highlighted how short it is, and the combination of her skirt and boots gives her prominent [[zettai ryouiki]].

title: dandelion_(girls'_frontline)
body:
A character in [[Girls' Frontline]].

[spoiler]Originally an OGAS born within [[M4A1 (girls' frontline)|]]'s Neural Cloud, under the influence of the Parapluie virus. Upon the removal of her neural cloud's seals, her OGAS would access a new stage of consciousness and realize it was an entity distinct from M4, yet living in her mind. Believing in the perfection of [[Elisa (girls' frontline)|]]'s Neural Cloud, and wishing to merge with her OGAS as to achieve the perfected form of OGAS, it would try to convince M4 to pursue its interests, believing it to be of benefit to the both of them (referring to M4 as [[Lunasia (girls' frontline)|]] all the while).

After several story developments, during which time it understood it could also access the minds of [[Nyto (girls' frontline)|]]s, during the events of Shattered Connexion, it would assimilate the Isomers of Tallinn, taking over the body of the [[Isomer Hivemind (girls' Frontline)|former Nimogen]] in the process. The assimilation process would mellow out its wishes, and prompt her to finally side with M4. With a physical body now, she would be dubbed "Dandelion" during Chapter 12.
[/spoiler]

h4. Appearance

* !post #3796865: Girls' Frontline
* !post #9038302: [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]]

title: okobo
body:
Japanese [[platform footwear|platform]] [[sandals]] that were traditionally worn by [[geisha]] during their apprenticeship. The most notable type in fanart are the black-lacquered kind with red straps. 

Technically, the black-lacquered finish is only worn mainly during summer, and the color of the straps used changes depending upon how far along the apprentice geisha is in her training.

Not to be confused with [[geta]], which have two square "teeth" on the sole instead of being made as a solid block, or [[zouri]], which are flat like flip flops.

title: basara_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
Character from [[Granblue Fantasy]]. Voiced by [[Majima Junji]].

Element: Light
Prof: Katana/Melee
Race: [[Erune]]
Height: 177 cm

Basara was the First Divine Canine and is the direct ancestor of [[Vajra (Granblue Fantasy)|Vajra]], the current Divine Canine. He is also recognized as the leader of the First Divine Generals, as well as the strongest fighter among the twelve. Notably, Vajra's abilities to channel souls and hear the spirits of nature originate from Basara; he was the first to exhibit those qualities among his family.

Following Vajra's final fate episode, Basara's spirit resides in Vajra's blade and will manifest upon Vajra's request. He plays a major role in the 11th anniversary event, [i]Romance of the Divine Generals[/i], where he made his playable debut as a Light-element Grand character exclusive to Flash Gala banners.

Visually, Basara resembles a [[geki]]; he wears a [[black hakama|black]] [[hakama]] with a white [[tabi]] and [[wide sleeves]], as well as [[shimenawa]] and [[waraji]]. He has [[brown eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] with an [[ahoge]]. As a canine-looking Erune, Basara has [[dog ears]].

title: minneapolis_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the heavy cruiser USS [i]Minneapolis[/i] (CA-36). Character designed by [[Mephisto (angraecum)|]], voiced by [[Shimamura Yuu]]. 

She is portrayed as a [[dark-skinned female|dark-skinned]] Native American girl with [[medium breasts]] and [[very long hair|very long]] [[white hair]] in a [[high ponytail]] with [[crossed bangs]] [[hair between eyes|between eyes]]. She has [[facepaint]] underneath her [[red eyes]] and [[bodypaint|on her body]]. 

Her outwear is a [[multicolored cape|multicolored]] [[red cape|red]], [[brown cape|brown]], [[blue cape|blue]], and [[white cape|white]] [[fur-trimmed cape]] with a [[brown hood]] [[hood up|up]]. The rest of her [[revealing clothes|outfit]] is a [[underboob]]-and-[[midriff]]/[[navel]]-exposing  [[breast curtain]], [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[brown gloves]], a [[loincloth]] with a [[brown skirt|brown]] [[showgirl skirt]] held with [[o-ring_bottom|o-rings]], [[highleg panties|highleg]] [[black panties]], and [[red footwear|red]] [[rudder footwear]] over [[ankle wrap]]s.

Her [[rigging]] is the [[huge weapon|huge]] [[cannon]] in the shape of her real-life hull.

title: kriemhild_valhanna
body:
A female character from [[Motto! Haramase! Honoo no Oppai Isekai Oppai Maid Gakuen!]]

h4.Profile
The Masochist Valkyrie Oppai Maid!
Phan De Minaj Maid Academy Third Year
Maid Disciplinary Committee and Maid Hunting Club Member

•Boobs: 120 cm ~「Master, please don't look up while licking them... Kufuuu♥」
•Nipples: 6.2 mm (Length) ~「Are they too big? Will you tease them a lot!?」
•Areolae: 36 mm (Diameter)~「The shape, the color... Don't fall in love with me!」
•Waist: 59 cm ~「Don't forget to train until your body is tight!」
•Hips: 92 cm ~「I'm a bit big... but that makes it easier to hit♥」
•Thighs: 46 cm (Thickness) ~「Sexual harassment is prohibited! Ah, but.... if you give the order♥」
•Vagina: 42.3 mm (Full Length) ~「You can store your sex sword here, Master♥」

She is a third-year student, a year older than the protagonist, and a Valkyrie girl who also serves as a member of the Discipline Committee. She has a well-trained and toned body and boasts Q-cup boobs.

She is a beautiful girl with a fine nose and eyes with a dignified atmosphere, which attracts the eyes of those around her. And she is also the head maid of the fellow maid group. As a Valkyrie, she should be strong in battle and in rough times, a dependable leader... But that is not the case at all. In fact, she is one of the most clumsy underachievers in the school, and her motivation and abilities are out of all proportion.

She is serious and straightforward, proud of her race, and has a strong sense of justice. Although she may sound like an excellent student, she is in fact a stupid girl, a waste-of-space Valkyrie that even her mother and teachers have a hard time wrapping their heads around. Basically, she is a girl who fails everything except subjects related to combat and physical education, and is a regular recipient of red marks. Moreover, she was happy for a while, thinking that a red mark was "a good mark". In addition, contrary to her appearance, she is sensitive to being dominated, and is aroused easily by anything. She sometimes orgasms in reaction to sneezing, and the protagonist compares her to an old man's urine leakage. Although she has many problems, she has a strong sense of camaraderie and is willing to put herself on the line to protect her friends, so she is well trusted by those around her. She is often teased by others, but often does not even realize she is being teased, which is a pity.

She belongs to the "Maid Hunting Club". The maids of Yggdrasil fight monsters to protect their masters, so the hunting club has a large presence in the school. Kriemhild, who is not very good at classroom learning but is at the top of her class when it comes to combat, is the captain of the club as well.

Her mother, Brynhildr, is also a Valkyrie, and is the captain of the Valkyrie unit which also includes the head of the school's security force. Kriemhild respects her mother more than anyone else, and they get along well, but her daughter's lack of ability makes her give up on her. However, she is trying to put her body on the line in the hope that the long-awaited master from another world will do something about it (in more ways than one).

title: marshall_d._teach
body:
One of the main antagonists of [[One Piece]], also called Blackbeard.

The captain of the Blackbeard Pirates, promoted to [[Shichibukai]] after the downfall of [[Crocodile (one Piece)|]], a title he merely used to break into [[Impel Down]] where he recruited a number of powerful level 6 prisoners. He later became one of the Four Emperors [spoiler]after defeating his former captain [[Edward Newgate]] in the climax of the Summit War of Marineford[/spoiler].

Having consumed the Yami Yami no Mi [[Devil Fruit]] he can basically turn into a black hole and control gravity, as well as capable of nullifying any Devil Fruit user by touching them.

[spoiler]He somehow absorbed [[Edward Newgate|Whitebeard's]] shock-creating Gura Gura no Mi powers after his death, becoming the first and possibly only user to possess two [[Devil Fruit]] powers at the same time.[/spoiler]

h4. See also
* [[Blackbeard writing (meme)]]
other_names: マーシャル・D・ティーチ

title: toradora!
body:
A 2006-2010 13-volume light novel series by Takemiya Yuyuko, with art by [[Yasu]]. Later adapted into a manga with art by [[Zekkyou_(h9s9)|]], an Internet radio show, a PSP visual novel, and a 2008 anime series by J.C. Staff.

[[Takasu Ryuuji]] and [[Aisaka Taiga]] are students feared throughout their school - Ryuuji, on account of his intimidating appearance (despite being a rather nice guy), and Taiga, on account of her short temper (despite her good looks). One day, they discover that they're neighbors, and have a crush on each other's best friends - Ryuuji to [[Kushieda Minori]] and Taiga to [[Kitamura Yuusaku]]. Both have since made a pact to help each other win their love interests, even as they start to become more than just partners...

h4. Characters

h6. Main

* [[Aisaka Taiga]]
* [[Kawashima Ami]]
* [[Kitamura Yuusaku]]
* [[Kushieda Minori]]
* [[Takasu Ryuuji]]

h6. Other

* [[Haruta Kouji]]
* [[Kanou Sakura]]

title: koby_(one_piece)
body:
[[One Piece]] character. Koby is initially an involuntary meek cabin boy of the [[Alvida (one piece)|]] pirates until he was rescued by [[Monkey D. Luffy]] at the beginning of his journey.

After the initial encounter, Kobe has joined the Marines and became a disciple of [[Monkey D. Garp]]. Eventually becoming the renowed member of the "SWORD" special force unit. Despite now being on the opposing sides, Koby and Luffy is still viewed each other as friends.

title: charlotte_katakuri
body:
A character from [[One Piece]]. Katakuri is the 3rd child of [[Charlotte Linlin|Big Mom]] and the elder triplet brother of [[Charlotte Daifuku]] and [[Charlotte Oven]]. He is also one of the Three Sweet Commanders of the Big Mom Pirates. 

Having consumed the Mochi Mochi no Mi [[Devil Fruit]], he can create, control, and transform into mochi.
other_names: シャーロット・カタクリ

title: sugar_(one_piece)
body:
[[One Piece]] character. A member of the [[donquixote_family|Donquixote Pirates]]' [[Trebol]] army. She is also the younger sister of [[Monet (one piece)|]].

Having consumed the Hobi Hobi no Mi [[Devil Fruit]], she can turn people into living toys. Additionally the power has stopped her aging, leaving her physically a [[loli|small child]].

title: buggy_the_clown
body:
[[One Piece]] character. Captain of a circus-themed pirate ship and [[monkey d. luffy|Luffy's]] rival. Formerly one of the [[Shichibukai]], and later on the [spoiler]de jure[/spoiler] leader of the Cross Guild [spoiler]and one of the Four Emperors.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]Buggy originally served as an apprentice for [[Gol D. Roger]]'s pirate crew alongside [[Shanks (one piece)|]].[/spoiler]

Having consumed the Bara Bara no Mi [[Devil Fruit]], he can split their own body into pieces and control said pieces however they wish.


He is voiced by [[Chiba Shigeru]].

title: crocodile_(one_piece)
body:
[[One Piece]] character, first introduced as one of the [[Shichibukai]] and the leader of the criminal organization [[Baroque Works]] under the codename Mr. 0. He later on co-founded Cross Guild with [[Dracule Mihawk]] and served as one of the de-facto leaders.

Having consumed the Suna Suna no Mi [[Devil Fruit]], he can manipulate and control sand as an extension of his own body.

title: sengoku_(one_piece)
body:
[[One Piece]] character. Fleet Admiral Sengoku is the leader of the Marines prior to the Summit War on [[Marineford]]. He along with his colleague Vice Admiral [[Monkey D. Garp]] are considered the only Marines that are capable of matching against the Pirate King [[Gol D. Roger]] during his lifetime.

Having consumed the Hito Hito no Mi, Model: Daibutsu [[Devil Fruit]], he can transform into a giant golden [[Buddha]] which gave him immense strength and an ability to launch shockwaves using palm thrusts.

title: alvina_zimlock
other_names: アルビーナ・ジムロック

title: dracule_mihawk
body:
[[One Piece]] character. First introduced as one of the [[Shichibukai]] and later become the de-facto co-leader of Cross Guild along with [[Crocodile (one piece)|]].

He is known as the greatest swordsman in the world for his immense mastery of swordsmanship and [[Haki (one piece)|]]. As such, he served as the final obstacle for [[Roronoa Zoro]] of the [[Straw Hat Pirates]] for the title.

After effortlessly defeated Zoro during their first encounter, Mihawk became impressed by Zoro's tenacity and spares him so that he could become stronger. Later on, during the timeskip, Mihawk hosted Zoro along with [[Perona]] on his home island, and would later train him various technique, including the usage of Haki.

h4. See also
* [[S-Hawk]]
other_names: ジュラキュール・ミホーク

title: janne_lindemann
body: [[Atelier Resleriana]] character.

title: kouzuki_oden
body:
Prominent background character from [[One Piece]]. Oden was a daimyo of Kuri province of Wano Country and the heir apparent of the Kouzuki Shogunate. He is married to [[Kouzuki Toki]] and have two children named [[Kouzuki Momonosuke|Momonosuke]] and [[Kouzuki Hiyori|Hiyori]].

Oden left Wano with the Whitebeard Pirates in order to partake an adventure outside of his isolated homeland. He would later temporarily joined the Roger Pirates led by [[Gol D. Roger]], who personally asked Oden's captain [[Edward Newgate]] to borrow him for his ability to read Poneglyphs, which is crucial for finding the One Piece.

[spoiler]After the Roger Pirates found the One Piece and subsequently disbanded, Oden was usurped and later executed via a conspiracy between [[Kurozumi Orochi]] and [[Kaidou (one piece)|]]. His execution involving him being boiled in a scathingly hot oil for an hour while holding a platform with his retainers sat on top of it as a part of the deal with Kaidou to spare them was later known as the "Legendary Hour". This particular event impressed the then young [[Yamato (one piece)|]] who has since idolized him and adopted masculine identity in order to be an adventurer like him one day.[/spoiler]

body:
A playable character from [[Reverse:1999]]. A mad scientist from the Laplace Scientific Computing Center, Medicine Pocket was born without reproductive organs and consider themselves non-binary (while Medicine Pocket prefers them/they pronouns, they will allow other people to use he/she pronouns on them much to their annoyance).

title: tuscaloosa_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the heavy cruiser USS [i]Tuscaloosa[/i] (CA-37). Character designed by [[Hoshiakari (C2 Kikan)|]]. 

She has [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her outfit consists of a [[blue shirt|blue]] [[collared shirt]], gradient [[necktie]], triangular [[hairclip]], [[blue skirt]], [[two-tone gloves]], [[chest harness]]es, [[white dress|white half-dress]] with a [[side slit]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two of her three historical 203 mm triple gun mounts with two [[aircraft catapult]]s, one of each on each side, held together by a [[smokestack|funnel]] piece to her back, and painted in base grey.

Her [[abyssal ship|abyssal]] form is assumed to be the [[Abyssal Heavy Cruiser Water Princess]].

title: cryptocurrency
body:
A digital [[money|currency]] designed to work through a computer network that is not reliant on any central authority.

Due to the nature of their value being based heavily on a speculation, cryptocurrencies have very unstable exchange rates. This speculative nature and regulatory oversight has resulted in them being tied with many get-rich-quick schemes, money laundering, and scams. 

"Memecoins", a category of cryptocurrencies that are predominately based on internet memes and jokes, tend to be some of the most volatile and prone to scams out of cryptocurrencies.

h4. Tagged cryptocurrencies
* [[Bitcoin]]
* [[Dogecoin]]
* [[Ethereum]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Cryptocurrency":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptocurrency]

title: sugi_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Sugi[/i]. Character design by [[Umihara Sakana]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[green hair]] with [[antenna hair|two ahoge]], and [[green eyes]]. Her default outfit, a variant of the [i]Matsu[/i]-class' uniform, is composed of a [[brown shirt|khaki]] [[sailor shirt]] with a [[white sailor collar]], [[black corset]] (with a [[zipper pull tab]]), [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt]], [[red thighhighs]], [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]], [[green ribbon]], [[grey apron]], [[grey choker]], and [[black boots|black]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life funnel and foremast (with [[radar]]) to her back, 25 mm triple [[anti-aircraft gun]]s on the rig, a 12.7 cm single [[handgun]] mount, and 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on her right [[thigh strap]]. 

h4. Appearance

title: child_safety_seat
body:
A seat used to protect [[baby|babies]] and small [[child]]ren when riding in a [[car]] or other vehicle.

Also known as a child seat, baby seat, car seat, or booster seat.

On August 22, 2024. Japan Automobile Federation (JAF) has announced that it is considering raising the recommended height for using child seats from under 140 cm to under 150 cm. Making a viral in Japan about all characters who having a height under 150 cm must be using a child seat, even they're teenager or adult.

h4. See also

* "Wikipedia: Child safety seat":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Child_safety_seat]

title: kronii_coin_(meme)
body:
A fake [[cryptocurrency]] that was started in "a joke stream":https://youtu.be/dI5UGWBcz2Y by the [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] [[Ouro Kronii]] in January 2025, after her YouTube channel was briefly hijacked by actual crypto scammers. This then led to fellow VTuber [[Mori Calliope]] doing a Coffeezilla-style "exposé stream":https://youtu.be/0SI55TdMVJI about Kronii Coin the very next day.
h4. External links
* "Know Your Meme: Kronii Meme Coin / $KRONII":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/kronii-meme-coin-kronii]

title: spiny
body: A character in the [[Mario (series)|]] franchise. These turtle-like enemies come with a (typically red) [[turtle shell|shell]] that is studded with spikes, making it dangerous for [[Mario]] and co. to jump on. [[Lakitu]] are known to throw [[Spiny egg]]s. A [[blue shell (mario)|blue version of its shell]] is a notable and infamous item in the [[Mario Kart]] series. h4. Official art * !post #6058557 h4. See Also * [[Spike Top]]

title: coffee_pot
body:
A container designed for serving [[coffee]]. This may mean:

* A small pourable pot, usually glass or metal, that is placed under a [[coffee maker|coffee brewer]] to capture the finished product and dispense it into a [[coffee mug]].
* A metal or ceramic vessel similar in design to a [[teapot]], but tall and slender, usually with a long spout attached near the base.

h4. Examples

* !post #7238463
* !post #9037220
* !asset #22726746

h4. See also

* [[disposable coffee cup]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: osaka_shizuku_(odaiba_beach_girl)
body:
A swimsuit costume for [[Osaka Shizuku]] from [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]], marketed originally as a PVC figurine.

The costume is a light [[blue bikini]]; a [[frilled bikini|frill trimed]] top fitted with a short sheer veil under the waist and a striped ribbon, and bottoms with a microskirt-like frill and two blue striped bows on the side. She wears a pearl [[armlet]] on the left arm and blue striped arm cuff. She wears [[white sandals|white]] [[sandals]] as her footwear. She's often seen carrying a [[transparent umbrella]].

h1. See also
* [[osaka shizuku (i cannot afford to slip here!)|I Cannot Afford to Slip Here!]]

other_names: 機動戦士ガンダム戦記

title: gundam_f90
body:
[b]Mobile Suit Gundam F90[/b] is a 1990 [[Gundam]] franchise event that features a series of plastic model, two manga series, and a short story, serving as a prologue to the film Mobile Suit [[Gundam F91]]. 

F90 sets the stage for some of the important events that would happen in F91, and also provides important details of the UC universe since [[Char's Counterattack]]. The manga eventually spurred a tie in model kit series.

h4.Notable mecha
* [[F90 Gundam]]
* [[MSA-0120]]

title: hasu_no_sora_gym_uniform
body:
The [[gym uniform]] worn by students of Hasu no Sora Girls' High School in [[Link! Like! Love Live!]].

It consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[shirt]] with [[short sleeves|short]] colored sleeves matching [[red sleeves|their]] [[aqua sleeves|year's]] [[yellow sleeves|neckerchief]], a [[black jacket|black]] [[track jacket]] also with matching colored highlights near the seams of its sleeves, and either [[black shorts|black]] [[shorts]] or [[black pants|black]] [[track pants]].

h4. Examples
* !post #7760042: Full track suit
* !post #8080204: Shorts

h4. See also
* [[Hasu no Sora school uniform]]

title: gianni_matragrano

title: shimane_maru_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese escort carrier [i]Shimane Maru[/i]. Character designed by [[Hoshiakari (C2 Kikan)|]]. 

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]] with [[twin braids]], grayish-[[blue eyes]], and [[small breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[sleeveless]] [[black shirt]], [[blue capelet|blue]] [[hooded capelet]], wooden tag with her name fastened to the capelet, [[brown corset]], [[grey skirt|grey]] [[hakama skirt]], [[grey thighhighs]] with her real-life camouflage pattern, black [[arm warmers]], [[black gloves]], and [[white boots]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life [[flight deck]] fastened to her right arm warmer, and a handheld [[searchlight]]. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #9037330

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: [i]Shimane Maru[/i]-class escort carriers":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shimane_Maru-class_escort_carrier]
other_names: しまね丸(艦隊これくしょん)

title: kinomoto_sakura
body:
Titular character from the anime and manga [[Cardcaptor Sakura]].

Sakura is introduced as a 10-year-old girl who lives in the town of Tomoeda in Japan, where she attends Tomoeda Elementary School during the [[Clow Card]] Arc and [[Sakura Card]] Arc storylines. In [[cardcaptor sakura clear card arc|Clear Card Arc]] storyline, she is a freshman attending Tomoeda Middle School.

h4. Costumes

h5. Notable costumes

* !post #7891573: [[kinomoto sakura (magician)|Magician]]
* !post #7752649: [[kinomoto sakura (miraculous sakura)|Miraculous Sakura]]
* !post #8084458: [[kinomoto sakura (astral sakura)|Astral Sakura]]
* !post #7734423: [[kinomoto sakura (clear wings)|Clear Wings]]

h5. Other costumes

For all of her tagged costume chartags, see the [[list of Cardcaptor Sakura characters]].

h4. See also

* [[Clow card]]
* [[Sakura card]]
* [[Clear card]]
* [[Fuuin no Tsue]], her "Sealing Wand."
* [[Hoshi no Tsue]], her "Star Wand."
* [[Yume no Tsue]], her "Dream Wand."
* [[Sakura hime]],  (Look alike character from [[Tsubasa Chronicle]])

h4. Tagged Costumes

This section is an alphabetical listing of Sakura's tagged official costumes, primarily those seen in both the 90s anime and in Clear Card Arc. They will be separated between the two series as well. The names are derived from [[Cardcaptor Sakura: Memory Key]], though the use of [i]italics[/i] indicates that the names are of fan origin, as listed on the "Cardcaptor Sakura wiki":https://ccsakura.fandom.com/wiki/List_of_Clothes_and_Costumes, as those do not have official names yet. Each of their wikis will detail when each costume is worn in the anime or manga, and what occurs during each instance.

Note that not every single one of Sakura's costumes are given chartags, particularly those only seen on manga covers. To search for those, use the {{kinomoto_sakura official_alternate_costume}} tags.

title: gundam_hathaway's_flash
body:
A novel series in the UC [[Gundam]] timeline. Set in [b]Universal Century 105[/b], 12 years after the events of [[Char's Counterattack]], the novels follow the exploits of [[Mafti Nabiyu Erin]] [spoiler]aka [[Hathaway Noa]][/spoiler], as he leads a terrorist cell against the [[Earth Federation]].

The novels will be adapted into a trilogy of films, with the first one released in June 11, 2021 after being delayed due to COVID-19. Previous to the adaptation's announcement, the original source material made appearances in multiple Gundam crossover games, and had it's SRW debut in [[Super Robot Wars V]].

Chronologically continued by [[Gundam F90]] and [[Gundam F91]].

title: den'an_zon
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in the [[Gundam F91]] anime film from 1991.

[b]XM-01 Den'an Zon[/b]

The primary [[mobile suit]] of the [[Crossbone Vanguard]], the Den'an Zon represented the true form of the miniaturized MS, displaying far greater performance than its opponent, the [[Earth Federation]] [[Heavygun]]. 

It carried the [[shot lancer]], designed to reduce the damage done to colonies with beam weaponry, along with the [[beam shield]], a powerful new defensive tool that would change warfare in the late universal century.

title: kaya_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Kaya[/i]. Character design by [[Umihara Sakana]]. 

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[orange hair]] with a [[huge ahoge]], and [[green eyes]]. Her default outfit, a variant of the [i]Matsu[/i]-class' uniform, is composed of a [[brown shirt|khaki]] [[sailor shirt]] with a [[white sailor collar]], [[black corset]] (with an [[anchor]] [[zipper pull tab]]), [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[red thighhighs]], [[black gloves]], [[green ribbon]], [[grey apron]], [[grey choker]], and [[black boots|black]] [[rudder footwear]]. Her black and white circle hairclips resemble [[go (board game)|go]] stones, referencing the fact that wood from her namesake tree, the Torreya nucifera, is used to make expensive go boards.

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life funnel and foremast (with [[radar]]) to her back, 25 mm triple [[anti-aircraft gun]]s on the rig, a 12.7 cm single [[handgun]] mount, and 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on her right [[thigh strap]].

title: momo_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Momo[/i]. Character design by [[Watanabe Akio]].

She is portrayed with [[long_hair|long]] [[pink hair]] with a [[green_hair|green]] [[gradient hair|gradient end]] tied into [[twintails]] with an [[ahoge]], [[red eyes]], and a [[fang]]. Her default outfit, the [i]Matsu[/i]-class uniform, is composed of a [[brown shirt|khaki]] [[sailor shirt]] with a [[grey sailor collar]], [[green neckerchief]], [[black corset]] (with an [[anchor]] [[zipper pull tab]]), [[grey_skirt|gray]] [[pleated skirt]], [[white thighhighs]], [[black gloves]], [[black choker]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[rudder footwear]].

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life funnel and foremast (with [[radar]]) to her back, 25 mm triple [[anti-aircraft gun]]s on the rig, a 12.7 cm single [[handgun]] mount, 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on her right leg, and [[depth charge]]s on her left leg.

Upon her introduction into the game, Momo was mistaken to be a pink-haired [[Matsushima Michiru]] of the [i][[grisaia_(series)|Grisaia]][/i] series, another title her illustrator was involved in.

Considers herself as the fleet's newest [[idol]], but the game's preexisting idol [[Naka (kancolle)|]] does not mind having her around. Considering this, some artists already have the two together side by side and coexisting, but others could not help but depict the latter as the stereotypical insecure idol wary of newcomers eating at their fanbase.

title: titleholder_(racehorse)
body:
Real Life Japanese Thoroughbred racehorse. Sired by [[Duramente (racehorse)|]] and foaled by Mowen. He is a bay horse with a stripe slanted over the right side of his face and pasterns on his right legs and his back left leg. He is [[Melody Lane (racehorse)|]]'s normal-sized younger brother and is famed for his front-runner running style even as a Stayer (long-distance runner).

One of the dominant colts of the 2021 generation, he is the winner of the 2021 Kikuka Sho, becoming the first to win this race as a front-runner since [[Seiun Sky (racehorse)|]] in 1998. He would later win the 2022 Spring Tenno Sho and the 2022 Takarazuka Kinen but, after a failed bet at l'Arc, he would eventually face [[Equinox (racehorse)|]]'s ascendence, and then injury at the 2023 Spring Tenno Sho. He would return for the Autumn season but never at his previous peak. He retired after his last race at the 2023 Arima Kinen, where he finished 3rd.

In the context of [i][[Umamusume]][/i], he, or a [[horse girl]] version of himself, is often depicted with his RL sire [[Duramente (umamusume)|]] or with fellow Erimo native [[Daring Tact (umamusume)|]] (especially when it involves fighting [[bear]]s). Alternatively, Titleholder (horse or horse girl) is often depicted with Melody Lane or with his contemporaries, [[Efforia (racehorse)|]] and [[Shahryar (racehorse)|]].

title: burn_knuckle
body:
One of [[Terry Bogard]]'s signature special moves that spans across the [[Fatal Fury]] and [[The King of Fighters|King of Fighters]] series. Terry throws his arms into the air, then lunges toward his opponent with his leading arm extended, having energy surround his fist, knocking the opponent down. Depending on the game, Terry will say either "Burn Knuckle!", "Burning!" or alternate between the two.

title: frutiger_aero
body:
Frutiger Aero is a visual aesthetic primarily utilized in the 2000s to early 2010s for commerical purposes, focusing on the mix of nature with technology, as well as an overall "glossy" look.

The name, coined by the Consumer Aesthetics Research Institute, originates from the "Aero" style from [[Windows 7]], and the Frutiger font.

Color palettes tend to consist of whites, blues and greens, and the occasional orange. Glossy textures are very common, as are semi-transparent elements. [[Lens flare]]s and [[bokeh]] are also frequently seen, along with "swirly" freeform shapes.

Common thematic elements include colorful [[tropical fish]] and other marine life (often jumping out of a body of shimmering blue [[water]]), [[glass]], bright green [[grass]], [[bubble]]s, the [[aurora]] phenomenon, [[blue sky|blue skies]], technology of the time period (i.e. [[flip phone]]s, 2000s [[computer]]s, [[digital media player]]s), and contemporary and retrofuturistic architecture.

h4. Examples

* !post #7016487 
* !post #3078769
* !post #755036
* !post #754662

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Frutiger Aero":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frutiger_Aero
* "Aesthetics Wiki: Frutiger Aero":https://aesthetics.fandom.com/wiki/Frutiger_Aero
* "Frutiger-Aero.org":https://frutiger-aero.org/frutiger-aero

h4. See also

* [[Frutiger Metro]]
* [[Vaporwave]]

title: return_of_the_mount_hua_sect
body:
The [b]Return of the Mount Hua Sect[/b], is a Korean webnovel, which recently released a manhwa/webtoon adaptation.

h4. Synopsis

The 13th disciple of the Great Mount Hua Sect. One of the Greatest Third-Generation Swordsmen. The Plum Blossom Sword Master, [[Cheongmyeong (return of the mount hua sect)|]].

After slicing the head of the peerless Heavenly Demon, who threw the world into chaos, he slept an eternal sleep on the peak of the Hundred Thousand Great Mountains. Jumping over a hundred years, he comes back in the body of a child.

title: cheongmyeong_(return_of_the_mount_hua_sect)
body:
The protagonist of [[return of the mount hua sect]]. 

Before his death, he was known as the 13th disciple of the Mount Hua Sect, he was called the Plum Blossom Sword Saint among the three great swordsmen who were active 100 years ago in the beginning of the novel.

One hundred years ago, at the end of the war, he participated as a member of the Jungwon Moorim corps to kill the Sect Leader of the Heavenly Demon Sect, Chun Ma. After surviving to the end until everyone died, he cuts his own head and dies from injuries as well. However, 100 years after his death, he comes back to life as a 15-year-old beggar named Cho Sam.

title: captcha
body:
An acronym for [b]Completely Automated Public Turing test to tell Computers and Humans Apart[/b]. It's a type of security measure designed to distinguish between human users and automated computer programs (bots).

CAPTCHAs present challenges that rely on human cognitive abilities that are currently difficult for computers to replicate reliably. These challenges often involve:

* Distorted Text ([[word captcha]]): Presenting text that is warped, rotated, or obscured in some way. Humans can usually decipher this text, but it's harder for OCR (Optical Character Recognition) software used by bots.
* Image Recognition: Asking users to identify specific objects in a set of images (e.g., "Select all images with traffic lights"). While computers are getting better at image recognition, CAPTCHAs can still be designed to be challenging enough for bots.
* Audio Challenges: Presenting audio clips of words or numbers that are distorted or have background noise. This is helpful for visually impaired users and still difficult for automated audio analysis.
* Mathematical Problems: Asking users to solve simple arithmetic problems.
* Logic Puzzles: Presenting simple logic or reasoning puzzles.

 The most popular one is reCAPTCHA, owned by [[Google]].

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: CAPTCHA":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CAPTCHA]
other_names: 私はロボットではありません

title: yamashiro_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese battleship [i]Yamashiro[/i]. Character design by [[Rikka (rikka331)|]], voiced by [[Fujita Saki]]. 

She has [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[black hair]] with her real-life pagoda mast as a [[hair ornament]] to her right, and [[red eyes]]. Her default outfit is a [[nontraditional miko]] style comprising a [[white kimono]] top, [[black sash|black]] [[obi]] with her fire control directors, [[red skirt|red]] [[hakama short skirt]], red [[thigh strap]], [[white socks]], and [[okobo]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is composed of her real-life 35.6 twin gun mounts arrayed two per side, and additional fire control directors on her [[knee pads]]. 

As she is very much an image of the classical Japanese beauty (in this case, the Yoshiwara geisha of Edo), she has been given the "小江戸美人戦艦" ("Beauty of Little Edo" Battleship) tag on Pixiv.

body:

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] in a [[ponytail]] tied with a red [[hair ribbon]], and [[brown eyes]]. 

Her default outfit is a [[nontraditional miko]] comprising a pale [[white kimono]] top, [[black shirt|black undershirt]], [[brown hakama]] tied around the waist with a [[sash]], [[brown socks]], and [[sandals]]. She always wears a [[katana]] at her side. Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life funnel and bridge to her back, five (or four at kai form) 41 cm twin gun mounts, and a [[radar]] and [[flight deck]] replacing one of her gun turrets at kai form. 

The Ise-class are the poster girls of KanColle Arcade, SEGA's card-based arcade adaptation of the browser game.

title: richelieu_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the lead ship of the French [i]Richelieu[/i]-class battleships. Character design by [[Akira (kadokawa)|]], voiced by [[Tanibe Yumi]].

She has light [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with a long lock [[long_hair_between_eyes|between her eyes]]. She has a [[mole under eye|mole under her left eye]] and another [[mole under mouth| below her mouth]].

Her outfit consists of a [[white beret]] with a red [[pom pom (clothes)|]] at the top, a [[two-tone dress|two-tone]] black-white-grey [[strapless dress]] with a [[belt]] under the breasts, a grey-black-red [[scarf]], black and white [[two-tone gloves]], a tricolore scarf tied on her left arm, black and white [[two-tone thighhighs]], and [[rudder footwear|rudder]]-styled [[loafers]].

The historical [i]Richelieu[/i] was laid down in 1935, launched in 1939 and still not fully complete at the start of [[World War II]]. She served both sides during the war. She began the war under [[Vichy]] France, notably helping fend off an Allied attack on Dakar. She joined the Allies in November 1942, and after a refit in New York was mostly employed in the Indian Ocean. After the war she served as a training ship and was eventually scrapped in 1968.

She is named after the "Red Eminence" [[Cardinal Richelieu]], a French clergyman and statesman.

title: i-401_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese submarine I-401, nicknamed "Shioi". Character design by [[shibafu_(glock23)|Shibafu]], voiced by [[Ise Mariya]]. 

She has [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[brown hair]] tied to a [[ponytail]], [[brown eyes]], [[tan]] skin, and is [[barefoot]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[blue swimsuit|blue]] [[school swimsuit]] with a [[name tag]], [[white shirt|white]] [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[side-tie shirt]] with an [[orange sailor collar]], and a [[hairclip]] patterned off her real-life fins. Her [[rigging]] consists of her torpedoes slung to her left side and her real-life conning tower, hangar, and [[aircraft catapult]] slung to her right. 

Her model is the Sen Toku-class aircraft-carrying submarine of the same name. The Sen Toku-class were once the largest submarines ever constructed and were originally meant for an attack on the Panama Canal. However, they were never used in any meaningful way as the few completed were only commissioned near the end of the war. The I-401 was sunk as a target off Pearl Harbor on May 31st 1946.

title: harusame_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Harusame[/i]. Character design by [[Kujou Ichiso]], voiced by [[Kanemoto Hisako]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] in a [[side ponytail]] with a [[blue hair|blue]] [[gradient hair|gradient end]], and [[red eyes]]. Her default outfit is the [i]Shiratsuyu[/i]-class' [[school uniform]]: a [[black_serafuku|black]] [[serafuku]], [[black socks]], and brown [[loafers]].

Her [[rigging]] at base form consists of her funnel to her back, a 12.7 cm twin gun mount handheld, and two 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s. She differs in that she also has a black [[canister]] with her, a reference to her real-life supply missions.

Her [[abyssal ship]] counterpart is [[Destroyer Princess]].

title: king_kong_(series)
body:
A franchise with various films, TV shows, cartoons, comics, and video games featuring [[King Kong]], a classic movie monster who resembles a gigantic ape. The character first appeared in the 1933 film King Kong, which received universal acclaim upon its initial release and re-releases. The film was later remade in 1976 and 2005.

In 2017, a new film "[[Kong: Skull Island]]" was released as part of the Monster Verse. This version of Kong would later appear in the 2020 film crossover [[Godzilla vs. Kong]].

title: king_kong_(2005)
body: King Kong is a 2005 epic adventure monster film co-written, produced, and directed by Peter Jackson. It is the ninth entry in the [[King Kong (series)|]] franchise and the second remake of the 1933 film of the same title, the first being the 1976 remake. The film stars Naomi Watts, [[Jack Black]], and Adrien Brody. Set in 1933, it follows the story of an ambitious filmmaker who coerces his cast and hired ship crew to travel to mysterious Skull Island. There they encounter various prehistoric creatures and a legendary giant [[gorilla]] known as [[King Kong|Kong]], whom they capture and take to [[New York City]].

title: school_of_rock
body: School of Rock (titled onscreen as The School of Rock) is a 2003 comedy film directed by Richard Linklater, produced by Scott Rudin and written by Mike White. The film stars [[Jack Black]], Joan Cusack, White and Sarah Silverman.

title: napoleonic_wars
body:
The collective name for a series of global [[war]]s between 1803 and 1815, between [[France]] under Emperor [[Napoleon Bonaparte]] and its allies and a series of European coalitions.

Though the coalitions were in the end able to finally defeat Napoleon, his campaigns across the continent decisively altered the balance of power in Europe. The [[Holy Roman Empire]] was finally destroyed, and the empires of [[Spain]] and [[Portugal]] were severely weakened. But the wars brought France back onto the world stage for the first time since the [[French Revolution]], cleared the way for [[Prussia]] for amass strength in the center of the continent, paved the way for the unification of [[Italy]] and [[German Empire]], and turned the [[United Kingdom]] into the center of world trade and commerce. 

It also allowed a great deal of breathing room for the new nation of the [[United States]] to develop unhindered by powerful foreign interests. The destruction of European empires also allowed the US to step in as the foremost power in the Western Hemisphere, and could rapidly expand in size by gobbling up land purchased from or abandoned by Europeans with concerns closer to home.

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:History]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Napoleonic Wars":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Napoleonic_Wars

title: the_great_mouse_detective
body: The Great Mouse Detective (released as Basil the Great Mouse Detective in some countries and The Adventures of the Great Mouse Detective during its 1992 re-release) is a 1986 American animated mystery adventure film produced by [[disney|Walt Disney Feature Animation]] and released by Walt Disney Pictures. Based on the children's book series Basil of Baker Street by Eve Titus and Paul Galdone, the film is written and directed by John Musker, Dave Michener, Ron Clements, and Burny Mattinson. Featuring the voices of Vincent Price, Barrie Ingham, Val Bettin, Susanne Pollatschek, Candy Candido, Diana Chesney, Eve Brenner, and Alan Young, the plot follows a mouse detective who undertakes to help a young mouse find and save her father from the criminal mastermind Professor Ratigan.
