title: harukana_receive
body: The story takes place in Okinawa, where [[Oozora Haruka (harukana receive)|]] forms a beach volleyball pair with [[Higa Kanata]]. Kanata, who couldn't handle the pressure put on her by her short height, had given up on beach volleyball already, but is convinced by Haruka to step back on the sand once again and aim for the junior tournament.

title: pete_(disney)
body: Pete (also named Peg Leg Pete, Bad Pete and Black Pete, among other names) is a cartoon character created by [[Walt Disney]] and Ub Iwerks of The Walt Disney Company. Pete is traditionally depicted as the villainous arch-nemesis of [[Mickey Mouse]], and was made notorious for his repeated attempts to kidnap [[Minnie Mouse]]. Pete is the oldest continuing [[Disney]] character, having debuted in the cartoon Alice Solves the Puzzle in 1925. He originally bore the appearance of an anthropomorphic [[bear]], but with the advent of Mickey in 1928, he was defined as a [[cat]].

title: daisy_duck
body: Daisy Duck is an American cartoon character created by the Walt Disney Company. She is an anthropomorphic white [[duck]] that has large eyelashes and ruffled tail feathers around her lowest region to suggest a skirt. She is often seen wearing a hair bow, blouse and heeled shoes. The girlfriend of [[Donald Duck]], Daisy was introduced in the short film Mr. Duck Steps Out (1940) and was incorporated into Donald's comic stories several months later. Carl Barks, the screenwriter and lead storyboard artist for the film, was inspired by the 1937 short, Don Donald, that featured a Latin character named Donna Duck, to revive the concept of a female counterpart for Donald.

title: tet_offensive
body:
The [b]Tet Offensive[/b] was a massive series of attacks by the [[Viet Cong|National Liberation Front]] and [[People's Army of Vietnam]] against the forces of the [[Army of the Republic of Vietnam]] and their international allies. It was the largest escalation of the [[Vietnam War]] to date, and was timed to coincide with (and thus named for) the traditional Vietnamese Tet lunar new year at the end of January, 1968. In the early morning of 30 January 1968, attacks began against hundreds of towns and cities all across South Vietnam. 

The Tet Offensive was a catastrophic military failure. Contrary to communist expectations, ARVN forces fought fiercely and repelled most of the attacks on their own, and South Vietnam's international allies were able to redeploy to assist faster than the North Vietnamese expected. The NLF engaged in open warfare for the first time since 1965 and were all but wiped out. Despite brutal fighting in the capital Saigon and city of Hue, the Tet Offensive was unable to accomplish any of their military goals. 

This fate was opposite, however, in the political sphere. The American public had been told by their leaders for months that the North Vietnamese were on the edge of defeat and incapable of launching an offensive of any kind. Public trust in their leader's ability to prosecute the war plummeted. As opposed to the [[Battle of Hamburger Hill]], which entered public consciousness for its seeming waste, Tet is known in public consciousness as the point when Western governments could no longer deny that they were losing in Vietnam. 

h4. See also

* [[Full Metal Jacket]]
* [[Tag group:History]]

h4. External links 

* * "Wikipedia: Tet Offensive":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tet_Offensive

title: evening_gown
body:
An evening gown is a long flowing women's [[dress]] usually worn to a [[formal clothes]] affair. It ranges from mid-calf to full-length, but never above the knees. Evening gowns are often made of a luxury fabric such as chiffon, velvet, satin, or silk. 

If the dress is knee-length of above consider [[cocktail dress]] instead. Evening gowns are formal wear, so they tend to not be extremely revealing, in such cases cocktail dress may be a better tag. 

H4. Examples
* !post #8617606
* !post #6411539
* !post #7323739

h4. See also

* [[cocktail dress]]
* [[gown]]
* [[Tag group:Attire]]
** [[Tag group:Dress]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Evening gown":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Evening_gown]

title: flash_step
body:
A character moving so fast that they effectively teleport.

In its simplest form, a character moves from one place to another in zero time. More commonly, the character will appear to blink out of existence, leaving an [[afterimage]] in their former location. Then after a small but non-zero amount time, they will reappear, usually behind their opponent.

title: leotard
body:
A [[skin tight]], one-piece [[bodysuit]] that covers the torso but leaves the legs free. They are usually [[sleeveless]]. They usually have a very simple design (often even just a single color), and are typically made of light fabrics to accommodate athletic activities. They are most often worn by acrobats, [[gymnastics|gymnasts]], [[dancer]]s, and circus performers.

They also influenced the [[one-piece swimsuit]] design, but swimsuits should not be tagged as leotards.

If the leotard does cover at least the upper legs, do not use this tag. Use [[bodysuit]] instead.

title: napoleon_bonaparte
body:
[b]Napoleon Bonaparte[/b], or later known as [b]Emperor Napoleon I[/b] was a [[France|French]] military leader and politician.

Famous for his military conquest campaign that turned France (which was severely crippled after [[french_revolution|the revolution]] and civil war) into a superpower. His campaign to conquer the entire continent caused several great European powers at that time to unite together in order to defeat him. After his final defeat in 1815, at the Battle of Waterloo, he was exiled to the remote Helena island and would die there in 1821.

Despite his defeat, Napoleon's campaign has tipped the balance of power of the entire continent, with the dissolution of the 1,000-year-old [[Holy Roman Empire]], severely weakened the [[Spain|Spanish]] and [[Portugal|Portuguese]] Empire and causing them to lose almost all of their new world colonies, and bringing France back into the European political stage being a notable example.

h4. See also
* [[Napoleon Crossing the Alps]]
* [[Napoleonic Wars]]
* [[Tag group:People]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Napoleon]

title: firelock
body:
A catchall tag for weapons depicting guns with firing mechanisms that predate the use of self-contained [[cartridge]]s and relied on an external mechanism to ignite the powder in the gun. 

The firing mechanisms this tag includes are, from oldest to newest: 

* [[Matchlock]]: A mechanism where a small lever, called a serpentine, holds a piece of slow burning match cord and lowers it into a pan of powder. The powder ignites and flame travel through a small hole in the pan into the barrel igniting the powder in the barrel. 
* !post #8728277

* [[Wheellock]]: A mechanism where a small arm, called a "dog", holds a piece of pyrite that strikes down against a spinning wheel of steel. This produces sparks that ignite a pan of powder that sends flame through a hole in the barrel and ignites the powder in the barrel. 
* !post #6023112

* [[Flintlock]]: A mechanism where a hammer holding flint strikes a piece of steel and produces sparks. The sparks fall into a pan of gunpowder and ignites the powder. A small hole from the pan to the barrel allows flame to travel and ignite the powder in the barrel. Replaced the matchlock and wheellock, replaced in turn by caplock.
* !post #8918689

* [[Caplock]]: A mechanism where a hammer strikes a percussion cap of shock-sensitive explosive that ignites and sends flame into the barrel igniting the gunpowder in the gun barrel. Replaced the flintlock, replaced in turn by [[cartridge]] guns. 
* !post #3423270 

If the weapon's firing mechanism is easily identifiable, use one of the more specific tags under this tag. If the weapon's firing mechanism is not easily identifiable, but is recognizable as a pre-cartridge firing mechanism, then just use this tag only and do not guess at one of the more specific types. 

h4. See also

* [[Antique firearm]] 
* [[Arquebus]]
* [[Musket]]
* [[List of weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia - Lock (firearm)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lock_(firearm)]

title: caplock
body:
A [[firelock]] mechanism where a hammer strikes a percussion cap lined with filament mercury, which  ignites and sends flame into the barrel, setting off the gunpowder inside. Was much more reliable than the [[flintlock]], which it replaced, but it was replaced in turn just half a century later by the advent of self-contained [[cartridge]]s, which eliminated the need for an external lock system altogether. 

The time period for the use of caplocks is almost exclusively the mid-19th Century: the Mexican-American War, [[Crimean War]], [[American Civil War]], and [[Boshin War]]. Though some caplocks would continue to be used in the American West, most would be converted by various methods to use cartridges.

h4. Appearance:

* !post #3423270

h4. See also:

* [[List of weapons]]
* [[Antique firearm]]
* [[Firelock]]
** [[Matchlock]]
** [[Wheellock]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia - Percussion cap":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Percussion_cap]

title: flintlock
body:
A [[firelock]] mechanism where a hammer holding flint strikes a piece of steel and produces sparks. The sparks fall into a pan of gunpowder and ignites the powder. A small hole from the pan to the barrel allows flame to travel and ignite the powder in the barrel. Thanks to its cheap cost and ease of use, the flintlock fully replaced the [[matchlock]] and [[wheellock]], and was the primary firearm mechanism until it was replaced in turn by the [[caplock]].

General time periods for the use of flintlocks span from the late [[Renaissance]] circa ~1610s to the [[Napoleonic Wars]] of the 1810s, including the Golden Age of Piracy, [[American Revolution]], and War of 1812 among many other world events. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #8918689

h4. See also

* [[List of weapons]]
* [[Antique firearm]]
** [[Musket]]
* [[Firelock]]
** [[Caplock]]
** [[Matchlock]]
** [[Wheellock]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Flintlock":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flintlock
* Guns.wikia.com: "Flintlock":https://guns.fandom.com/wiki/Flintlock

title: matchlock
body:
The first firing mechanism or "lock" used in [[antique_firearm|antique firearms]]. It used an arm that held a burning piece of match cord that would be lowered into a pan of powder that would ignite the firearm.  This mechanism could be as simple as an "S" shaped lever called a [i]serpentine[/i] that would lower the arm into the pan or it could use a locking mechanism and spring that upon releasing the lock would "snap" the arm rapidly into the pan. The latter type of matchlock were referred to as "snap matchlocks." Most [[arquebus|arquebuses]], including the Japanese tanegashima, were matchlocks.

General time periods for use include the late Medieval to early [[Renaissance]] eras, including Japan's [[Sengoku Jidai]].

This firing mechanism was theoretically replaced by the [[wheellock]], but due to cost, would not be completely replaced until the [[flintlock]].

h4. Appearance:

* !post #8728277

h4. See Also:

* [[List of weapons]]
* [[Antique firearm]]
* [[Firelock]]
** [[Caplock]]
** [[Wheellock]]

title: wheellock
body:
A mechanism to fire an [[antique firearm]] that was the technological successor to the [[matchlock]].  It would use a small arm, called a "dog", to hold a piece of pyrite that'd strike down against a spinning wheel of steel to produce sparks.  These sparks would ignite a pan of gunpowder that would send flames through a small hole in the barrel to ignite the powder in it. Due to the complicated design and high cost, it never fully replaced the matchlock, and instead both match and wheellocks would be replaced by the cheaper and less complicated [[flintlock]].

General time period of use would be the mid [[Renaissance]] era. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #6023112

h4. See also

* [[Firelock]]

h4. External link

* "Wikipedia - Wheellock":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wheellock]

title: hero's_sibling_(dq10)
body:
The [b]Hero's Sibling[/b] is a major character in [i][[Dragon Quest X]][/i]. As their name suggests, they are the adoptive sibling of X's [[hero_(dq10)|Hero]] or [[heroine_(dq10)|Heroine]]. Their appearance and name are customizable and can be adjusted by the player. When in their adult forms, both versions of the sibling look identical to the Hero's opposite gender counterpart.

Notable outfits worn by the sibling to differentiate them from the Hero/Heroine:
-A [[double-breasted]] suit in green and red.

title: sumire_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Leader of the Athletic Training Club. Her full name is Otohana Sumire.

She has a [[purple halo]] [[very long hair|very long]] [[black hair]] tied into a [[high ponytail]] hid a [[purple scrunchie|purple]] [[hair scrunchie|scrunchie]] and decorated with small purple [[hair flower|flower]]s, [[purple eyes]], and [[medium breasts]]. She is also often depicted with [[abs]] in fanarts.

Her regular outfit consists of a [[green choker]], a [[white sports bra]], an [[open_jacket|open]] [[white jacket]], [[black_pants|black]] [[yoga pants]] and [[sneakers]]. She also wears [[earbuds]], [[yellow-tinted eyewear]], [[sunglasses]] [[eyewear hang|hanging]] from her sports bra and a [[green_wristband|green]] [[sweatband]] on her right wrist.

Her personal weapon is a [[Benelli M4]] [[shotgun]].

Voiced by: [[Imai Asami]]
Original artist: [[famepeera]]

body:
Original title: 墓場鬼太郎([i]Hakaba (no) Kitarō[/i]), lit. [i] Kitarou (of the) Graveyard[/i]

A Supernatural/Horror manga by [[Mizuki Shigeru]], also known as [i]Spooky Kitaro[/i] in some regions, serialized in [i]Weekly Shōnen Magazine[/i] from 1959-1969.

Numerous anime and live action adaption have been made since 1968 but on January 2008 the original comic was adapted into an anime by Toei Animation.

title: pinocchio_(disney)
body: Pinocchio is a 1940 American animated musical fantasy film produced by Walt Disney Productions and released by RKO Radio Pictures. Loosely based on Carlo Collodi's 1883 Italian children's novel The Adventures of Pinocchio, it is the studio's second animated feature film, as well as the third animated film overall produced by an American film studio, after Disney's [[Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs]] (1937) and Fleischer Studios' Gulliver's Travels (1939).

title: medarot
body: Medarot (メダロット, Medabots), is a Japanese role-playing video game franchise created by Rin Horuma (Horumarin) and currently owned by Imagineer. The main series of RPGs focus on collecting and battling with the titular robots. The bulk of the games releases have been on Nintendo platforms, including the [[Game Boy]], [[GameCube]], and the DS, and 3DS handhelds.

title: silent_witch
body:
A 2021-to-Present shoujo fantasy web novel series written by Isora Matsuri (依空まつり) and illustrated by [[Fujimi Nanna]] in the light novel version published by Kadokawa.  A manga adaptation also began publication in 2021 under the title [i]Silent Witch - Chinmoku no Majo no Kakushigoto[/i] (サイレント・ウィッチ 沈黙の魔女の隠しごと, En: [i]Secrets of the Silent Witch[/i]) drawn by Tana Tobi (桟とび "X Account":[https://x.com/_tana_tobi_]).
An anime adaption is set to premiere in July 2025.

h4.Plot
The story follows Monica Everett, a teenage mage and the youngest of the Kingdom of Ridill's Seven Sages and named the [i]Silent Witch[/i] .  As one of the Seven Sages, the highest rank of mage within the kingdom, she is famous for her ability of chantless casting of magic.  Unknown to the public though, Monica suffers from extreme social anxiety which is why she ended up developing the ability for chantless casting, as she simply lacked the ability to recite a spell in front of people.  Preferring to not interact with people, she spends most of her time doing mathematical work for the kingdom while living as a recluse. Things take a drastic turn when her fellow Seven Sage member Louis Miller, the [i]Barrier Mage[/i], barges into her home to ask her a favor, a favor she is not allowed to decline.  He is assigning her the task of infiltrating Serendia Academy, an elite boarding school, to covertly guard the kingdom's second prince without letting him find out.

h4. Characters
* [[Monica Everett]] (protagonist, alias Monica Norton)
* [[Cyril Ashley]]

body: A character from the Hebrew [[the bible|Bible]] and the Qur'an. He was the king of the Israelites especially famous for slaying the very tall Philistine [[Goliath (bible)|]] (he first disabled him with a stone fired from a sling before beheading him with a sword) despite being a young shepherd with no military experience at the time. title: karakida_hanto
body: Secondary protagonist of [[Kamen Rider Gavv (series)|]]. Hanto is a freelance writer who searches for the monster who kidnapped his mother, later revealed to be a Granute working for the Stomach family. After his mentor and father figure is all but name killed by a Granute, he goes to [[Suga Kenzo]], a human researching Granutes. Suga surgically implants Granute organs into Hanto, allowing the latter to use [[Gochizo|Gochizos]] and transform into [[Kamen Rider Valen]].

title: ozen
body:
[quote]For the Japanese term "お膳":[https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Tourists_dinner_in_Japan.jpg], use [[table]].
[/quote]
A character from [[Made in Abyss]].

Ozen "[i]The Immovable[/i]" is a legendary white whistle Delver who has made outstanding discoveries of The Abyss and retrieved numerous artifacts of incredible value. Even among her fellow white whistles, Ozen is renowned for her incredible physical strength. She is a mysterious entity, shrouded by countless rumors that are absurd but hard to refute. She lives at the Seeker Camp within the 2nd Layer of the Abyss, where she commands a small team of cave raiders known as "[i]The Layabouts.[/i]"

Ozen is a tall and rather slim woman, she has black [[short hair]] with white streaks. Often seen wearing a [[black coat]] and a [[black cape]]. When fully equipped for delving, she wears bulky [[black armor]] and a disc-shaped [[hat]] that covers her eyes.
Due to the [[Thousand-Men pin]]s embedded in her body she is usually depicted with [[gradient skin]] and/or [[colored extremities]] when [[nude]] or [[partially undressed]].

h4. See also

* "Made in Abyss Wiki: Ozen":http://madeinabyss.wikia.com/wiki/Ozen

title: black_(sprunki)
body:
Appearance
Normal (Non-Canon)
Black is a pitch-black Sprunki without a visible mouth, wearing a top hat that is the same color as his body, and a white tie. His eyes are visible, but only the sclera due to the pupil and eyelids being black.

Horror
Black looks drastically different in his horror version. He is slightly taller than the other characters, and his body is more caved in. He has a balloony-looking head in Horror Mode, and instead of having the typical cartoonish features of most characters within the mod, Black’s face is replaced by a duotone realistic human face (the majority of which is shrouded in darkness). In addition, Black emits a heavy ambiance similar to distorted radio feedback.

Horror Loop
Black plays a horror ambiance, and his sprite stays idle as the loop plays.

body:
A romcom manga by [[Wakaki Tamiki]].
[[Oohara Takuya]] and [[Honjouji Rika]] work at the traveling agency JTC. One day, there's an announcement that one of the unmarried employees will be transferred to the company's new branch office in Alaska. As they both are unmarried and none of them wants to go, the agree to get falsely engaged to avoid getting transferred. But will things go just as smoothly as they first thought?
An anime adaption aired in 2004.

h4.Characters
h5.Main
* [[Oohara Takuya]]
* [[Honjouji Rika]]

h5.JTC
* [[Kurokawa Asako]]
* [[Komiya Natsumi]]
* [[Shinshi Shou]]
* [[Itsuki Keisuke]]
* [[Gonda Hiromi]]
* [[George (365 days to the wedding)|George]]

h5.Others
* [[Claudia (365 days to the wedding)|Claudia]]
* [[Miyama Nao]]


h4. External Links
* "Official Site (jpn)":https://365-wedding-anime.com/
* "Official X (jpn)":https://x.com/kekkon_anime
* "Wikipedia (eng): 365 Days to the Wedding":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/365_Days_to_the_Wedding

title: hasu_no_sora_fantasy
body:
A [[fantasy]] setting based on [[Link! Like! Love Live!]], hashed out in a few of [[Hinoshita Kaho]]'s streams.

h4. Roles
* [[Yugiri Tsuzuri]] - [[flaming sword]]-wielding main protagonist
* [[Murano Sayaka]] - [[cryokinesis|ice mage]]
* [[Otomune Kozue]] - healer
* [[Hinoshita Kaho]] - [[animal]] tamer
* [[Osawa Rurino]] - [[elf]] archer
* [[Fujishima Megumi]] - traveling merchant
* [[Kachimachi Kosuzu]] - [[fairy]]
* [[Momose Ginko]] - [[miko]]
* [[Anyoji Hime]] - [[crossbow]] archer

h4. External links
* "If we were in a fantasy world...":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XytOnKYX_64
* "If we were in a fantasy world... 2!":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lZIT5R3Hx_s
other_names: ハスノソラファンタジー

title: list_of_real_life_racehorses
body:
This list covers all racehorses that exist(ed) in [[real life]] by the country they were trained in in alphabetical order that have a tag on Danbooru. As such, characters from [[Midori no Makibaoo]] and other [[horse]]-themed works will not be covered. For the horses' [[Umamusume]] counterparts, please see [[list of umamusume characters]]. However, please note that umamusume-fied horses with no canon-counterparts will still be tagged under their racehorse version.

See also [[list of real life animals]] for other real life animals.

title: straw_cape
body:
([i]mino[/i])

A traditional Asian raincoat made out of straw. Often used with an [[ajirogasa]] and "kanjiki snowshoes":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Snowshoe].

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mino_%28straw_cape%29]

* [[mino boushi]]

* [[namahage]]
* [[bushidou (sekaiju)]]

* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

title: horse_racing
body:
A type of race that involves multiple [[horse|horses]] and their [[jockey|jockeys]] competing for who can run the fastest over a set distance. Often times it is associated with [[gambling]], especially in Japan where the sport is more or less state sanctioned (either through the [[Japan Racing Association|JRA]] or the "NAR":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Association_of_Racing]).

h4. See also

* [[Umamusume]]
* [[List of Real Life Racehorses]]

title: gambling
body:
To play a game of chance for money or other stakes. A person will risk money or other items of value to play a game of luck and chance, hoping that they will win and earn money/items of higher value than what was risked.

Various games are designed for gambling purposes, and an institution that employs people to deal in these games are called [[casino|casinos]].

h4.See also

* [[horse racing]]
** [[Japan Racing Association]]
* [[pachinko]]
* [[playing card]]
* [[poker chip]]
* [[roulette table]]
* [[slot machine]]

title: three_of_swords
body:
A [[tarot]] card depicted as a [[heart]] pierced by three [[sword]]s, sometimes worn as a [[jewelry]] or [[brooch]] design. 

In fortune-telling it is considered one of the worst cards one can pull, being a symbol of impending heartbreak, betrayal, or emotional devastation, with its "reversed" reading merely indicating the sorrow will be blunted by circumstances or be milder than it could have been.

title: denver_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the US Navy light cruiser USS [i]Denver[/i] (CL-58). Character design by [[Huanxiang Heitu]], voiced by [[Ozawa Ari]].

In-game, she is shown with [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] tied in [[short twintails]], and [[blue eyes]]. She also wears a [[double-breasted]] [[black dress]], black [[knee boots]], and black legwear that matches the height of the knee boots. Unlike her sisters [[Cleveland (Azur Lane)|]], [[Montpelier (Azur Lane)|]], and [[Birmingham (Azur Lane)|]] that wear [[white cape|white capes]], she prefers a [[white coat]] with [[long sleeves]] and her name printed on it.

Her rigging is the same [i]Cleveland[/i]-class rig, with the 15.2 cm triple mounts on one side and 12.7 cm twin mounts on another.

title: pretty_x_cation
body:
An [[eroge]] [[visual novel]] developed by [i]Hibiki Works[/i] in 2014, with artwork by [[Oryo (oryo04)|]] released in 2014. An anime adaptation by [i]Pink Pineapple[/i] in 2016.

h4. Synopsis
Spring has come to Tokyo once again, except this year you're now living alone after your parents had to leave due to work. You're renting a room at an apartment run by your aunt, who bluntly asks you, "Could it be that you're not interested in girls...?" Well, of course you are! It's just that you haven't had much luck finding someone. "Your youth is now. Go and find your love or you will regret it later." With just that little push, you feel a little confident that it's your time to fall in love. Yes, your love will begin to bloom now...

(Source: VNDB)

title: hand_to_weapon
body:
When a character has a hand near a weapon (especially the hilt) without [[holding weapon|holding]] or [[hand on weapon|touching it]].

Some common situations like:
* Ready to [[holding weapon|hold]]/[[hand on weapon|touch]] a weapon that is already being held or carried. Sometimes it can be used together with [[ready to draw]].
* Ready to hold/touch a weapon that is not held.
* A [[floating weapon]] that [[object floating above hand|floating above hand]] or by [[telekinesis]].

title: nacho_libre
body: Nacho Libre is a 2006 sports comedy family film written by Jared Hess, Jerusha Hess, and Mike White, and directed by Jared Hess. It stars [[Jack Black]] as Ignacio, a Catholic friar and secret lucha libre fan who moonlights as a luchador to earn money for the orphanage where he works. The film is loosely based on the story of Fray Tormenta ("Friar Storm", a.k.a. Rev. Sergio Gutiérrez Benítez), a real-life [[mexico|Mexican]] Catholic priest who had a 23-year career as a masked luchador to support the orphanage he directed.

A type of "Special Operations" transformable and heavily armed and armored small [[mobile suit]]s operated by the [[Earth Federation Space Forces]] ECOAS. 

The fire support and troop transport units are piloted by [[Daguza Mackle]] and [[Conroy Haagensen]].

title: shortstack
body:
Literally "short" + "stacked" (having [[large breasts|large]]/[[huge breasts]] [b]and/or[/b] [[wide hips]]). Usually used to refer to an adult female specimen of a fictional race that is shorter than humans, but may also refer to humans of unusual proportions. Differs from [[oppai loli]] in that the shortstack is clearly an adult despite their short stature, while an oppai loli appears childlike apart from the curves.

Consider using [[pear shaped figure]] when [[breasts|bust]] is less emphasized, as there is less [i]stacking[/s].

h4. Shortstack Races and Characters

title: mandarin_collar
body:
A mandarin collar, standing collar, band collar or choker collar is a short, unfolded, stand up–style collar on a shirt or jacket. The style derives its Western name from the mandarin speaking bureaucrats in [[qing dynasty|Qing]]-era China that employed it as part of their uniform. [[Changpao]], [[Tangzhuang]] and [[China dress]]es often feature a mandarin collar.

H4. Examples
* !post #8333766

* !post #8078499

title: pov_stabbing
body:
The viewer is being [[stab]]bed, has just been stabbed, or will imminently be stabbed. Usually, this is indicated by someone [[facing viewer|facing the viewer]] [[holding weapon|wielding]] and thrusting with a [[weapon]] going partially out of frame off the bottom or top border of the image. Artist's intent does not have to be an actual [[pov]].

It's like [[aiming at viewer]] but with a knife, and the knife is often already in you.

title: bagpipe_(arknights)
body:
[i]Bagpipe, former Victorian soldier, has come in search of the truth.[/i]

A playable Vanguard Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: [spoilers]Fiona Young[/spoilers]

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Victoria[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]July 17[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Vouivre[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]167 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]5 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A seasoned combatant from the 2nd Tempest Platoon of the Victorian Army who joined Rhodes Island upon [[ch'en_(arknights)|Ch'en's]] recommendation. Uses a piledriver spear as her preferred weapon. Well-versed with farming and operating agricultural machinery due to her countryside lifestyle.

Often compared to [[Nakano Nino]] from [[Go-Toubun no Hanayome]] due to her appearance.

One of the main characters of the story [i]Episode 9: Stormwatch[/i].

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Toyosaki Aki]] (Japanese), Shen Yue (Chinese), Lauren Conroy (English) and Son Seon-young (Korean). Her art designer is [[U-suke (supertie)|]].

title: power_rangers_cosmic_fury
body:
The twenty-sixth series in Hasbro's [[Power Rangers]] franchise, largely adapting stock mecha footage from [[Uchuu Sentai Kyuuranger]], while building off elements from [[Kishiryu Sentai Ryusoulger]] as a direct follow-up to [[Power Rangers Dino Fury]].

In a move unseen since the Saban Era during [[Mighty Morphin Power Rangers|Mighty Morphin]], Ranger suits, some villains, and on-ground fights would all be entirely original, and all filmed in New Zealand with no carryover to boot, as well as being made into a shorter mini-series like [[Mighty Morphin Alien Rangers|Alien Rangers]] - to mixed results. Particularly, the Ranger suits, which would largely be original save for the adapted Ryusoulger helmets, saw greater online ridicule from the wider tokusatsu "community":[https://twitter.com/SRFlubber/status/1694101955012936151], including from "Japan":[https://twitter.com/koba200x1/status/1875000942468460718].
other_names: パワーレンジャー・コズミックフューリー

body:

title: driver_(project_wingman)
body:
The player character in [[Project Wingman]]'s campaign DLC; Project Wingman: Frontline 59. A reservist for the Federation Air Reserve, Driver serves as the flight lead for Division K-9. Like [[Monarch_(Project_wingman)|Monarch]] in the main campaign, if the player should fly a two-seater aircraft, he will be joined by a WSO, in Driver's case; [[eye-tee_(project_wingman)|Eye-Tee]].

As Division K-9's TAC names are based on their civilian professions, Driver has an unspecified motorized job.

title: eye-tee_(project_wingman)
body:
A character in [[Project Wingman]] serving as the [[driver_(project_wingman)|Driver's]] WSO when flying a two-seater aircraft. 

As Division K-9's TAC names are based on their civilian professions, Eye-Tee is an IT technician.

title: linear_hatching
body:
Drawing lines (parallel or not) with the purpose of darkening areas of an image. The lines must not intersect, otherwise it's [[crosshatching]]

Note that this tag is [u]not[/u] mutually exclusive with other subtypes of [[hatching (texture)|hatching]], an artist may use [[woven hatching]] or [[crosshatching]] as well.

h4. Examples

* !asset #25281457: Linear hatching with non parallel lines
* !post #537649: Linear hatching with parallel lines
* !post #4331051: Linear hatching, woven hatching and crosshatching.

h4. See also

* [[hatching (texture)]]
** [[crosshatching]]
** [[woven hatching]]

title: crosshatching
body:
A shading technique that uses intersecting lines of varying densities to simulate varying levels of darkness. A lightly colored object will have few lines, whereas a very dark object may have so many lines as to be solid black. Crosshatching is a variant of simple [[hatching_(texture)|hatching]] and may have two or more directions in which the lines lie.

Note that this tag is [u]not[/u] mutually exclusive with other subtypes of [[hatching (texture)|hatching]], an artist may use [[woven hatching]] or [[linear hatching]] as well.

h4. Examples

* !asset #25281482: Crosshatching 
* !post #6575889: Mostly crosshatching
* !post #4331051: Linear hatching, woven hatching and crosshatching.

h4. See also

* [[Hatching (texture)]]
** [[Linear hatching]]
** [[Woven hatching]]

body:
The gourd is a member of the plant family Cucurbitaceae and a relative of the [[pumpkin]]. When dried, its fruit can be hollowed out and used as a container. It is also used as food.

Most commonly depicted on Danbooru is the dumbbell-shaped fruit of the bottle gourd, or calabash, which can be used to hold liquids like [[sake]].

title: shinomiya_kaguya
body:
The female protagonist of [[Kaguya-sama wa Kokurasetai ~Tensai-tachi no Renai Zunousen~]] and vice president of the student council of Shuchiin Academy. She is a multi-talented genius who can do anything if she sets her mind to it, however, due to growing up sheltered, it resulted in her lacking in several pieces of what might be considered common sense. Her main objective is to make [[Shirogane Miyuki]] fall in love and confess to her.

She has [[red eyes|red]] [[tareme|tareme eyes]], [[small breasts]], and [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] stylized in a [[folded ponytail]] with [[parted bangs]] & [[sidelocks]]. She usually wears the [[Shuuchiin Academy school uniform]] with a [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon]].

In her cold-hearted "Ice" form, she lets her [[hair down]] [[long hair|long]] and her eyes become [[tsurime]].

In the anime, she is voiced by [[Koga Aoi]] in Japanese and [[Alexis Tipton]] in English.

h4. See Also

* [[okawaii koto]]
* "Kaguya-Sama Wiki: Shinomiya Kaguya":https://kaguyasama-wa-kokurasetai.fandom.com/wiki/Kaguya_Shinomiya

title: tokidoki_bosotto_roshia-go_de_dereru_tonari_no_alya-san
body:
[i]Alya Sometimes Hides Her Feelings in Russian[/i] (Hepburn: Tokidoki Bosotto Roshiago de Dereru Tonari no Ālya-san), abbreviated as [i]Roshidere[/i], is a Japanese light novel series written by SunSunSun and illustrated by [[Momoko (momopoco)|]]. It was originally published online as two short stories on the novel publishing website "Shōsetsuka ni Narō" from May 6 to May 27, 2020, respectively. It was then acquired by Kadokawa Shoten, who have published nine volumes and a short story volume since March 2021 under their Kadokawa Sneaker Bunko imprint.

A manga adaptation by [[tenacitysaho|Saho Tenamachi]] began serialization online on Kodansha's Magazine Pocket website and app in October 2022. An anime adaptation by DogaKobo has started airing on July 3, 2024.

h4. Synopsis
[[Alisa Mikhailovna Kujou]] is a half-Russian, half-Japanese high school student who attends one of Japan's best institutions, Seiren Private Academy. With her unparalleled looks and silky silver hair, she can make anyone turn around if she walks past them. Her elegant persona, alongside intelligence, has made her the idol of her school.

On the other hand, Alisa's benchmate [[Kuze Masachika]] is an unmotivated student who sleeps in classes and always plays gacha games. Unable to be honest, Alisa sometimes expresses her thoughts in Russian so that Masachika won't understand. However, unbeknownst to her, Masachika understands Russian as well at the native level.

h4. Characters
h5. Main
* [[Alisa Mikhailovna Kujou|Alisa Mikhailovna "Alya" Kujou]]
* [[Kuze Masachika]]
h5. Secondary & Supporting

title: slingshot_swimsuit
body:
A slingshot swimsuit, also known as a sling bikini or mankini for males, is a type of [[swimsuit]] that stretches from the crotch, separates to cover the nipples, up over the shoulders and across the back. It can be best described as a [[thong]] that goes over the shoulders, providing minimal coverage to the wearer. Such a swimsuit can be described a having a V-front, although swimsuits that seem to be like X-top bikinis from the front with no clear indication as a bikini otherwise from the side have been described here in Danbooru as also slingshots. 

A common gag is that the [[areola slip|straps fail to completely]] [[nipple slip|cover the nipples]].

While slingshot swimsuits are technically [[one-piece swimsuit|one-piece swimsuits]], they are considered to be in their own category and should not be tagged as one-piece swimsuits.

h4. See also

* [[slingshot tan]]
* [[sling bikini top]]
* [[pretzel bikini]]
other_names: スリングショット水着
眼帯スリングショット

For characters riding sideways on a horse or broom or bicycle, see [[sidesaddle]].

title: langley_ii_(azur_lane)
body: The personification of the [i]Independence[/i]-class USS [i]Langley[/i] (CVL-27) in [[Azur Lane]]. Not to be confused with [[Langley (Azur Lane)|her namesake predecessor, CV-1]], although it is specified that Langley II has the body and memories of the original Langley but with [i]Independence[/i]-class equipment and abilities. As she is basically the original [i]Langley[/i] with a new rig, her physical attributes remain unchanged ([[long hair|long]] [[green hair]], [[brown eyes]], [[small breasts]], wearing [[glasses]]) except a slight height increase. Her outfit as an [i]Independence[/i]-class light carrier is now composed of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[shirt tucked in]], [[black jacket]], striped [[necktie]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pencil skirt]], [[black thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]], [[black footwear|black]] [[rudder footwear]], and [[black gloves]]. Her new [[rigging]] comprises two halves of her [[flight deck]], one on each side, with two [[anti-aircraft gun]]s per rig and operating a mix of newer wartime aircraft with older biplanes from her previous form. h4. Skins * !post #5920478: Default * !post #5923681: [[langley_ii_(on-the-clock_vacation)_(azur_lane)|On-the-Clock Vacation]] (can be used on the original Langley) h4. Related characters h5. Azur Lane Type II Ships * [[Yorktown II (Azur Lane)|Yorktown (CV-10) / Yorktown II]] (Yorktown-class to Essex-class) * [[Hornet II (Azur Lane)|Hornet (CV-12) / Hornet II]] (Yorktown-class to Essex-class) * [[Northampton II (Azur Lane)|Northampton (CA-125/CLC-1) / Northampton II]] (Northampton-class to Oregon City-class) * [[Hammann II (Azur Lane)|Hammann (DE-131) / Hammann II]] (Sims-class destroyer to Edsall-class destroyer escort) * [b]Langley (CVL-27) / Langley II[/b] (Proteus-class (converted) to Independence-class) * [[Laffey II (Azur Lane)|Laffey (DD-724) / Laffey II]] (Benson-class to Allen M. Her default outfit consists of a [[blue cape]], [[white dress]], [[white thighhighs|white]] [[thigh boots]], and holds a mast. title: bataan_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the US Navy light carrier USS [i]Bataan[/i] (CVL-29).
Character design by [[Nin (lion)|Nin]], voiced by [[Fujita Akane (voice Actor)|]].

In-game, she sports [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. She is shown wearing a [[bodysuit]] under a [[corset]], collared [[white shirt]] and [[red necktie]], [[white gloves]], and an [[open jacket]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of four flight deck segments: two upper parts attached to the back and two lower parts jointed to the main rig with their own funnel.

She is also shown holding an [[F6F Hellcat]], a reference to one of her skills.

title: montpelier_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the light cruiser USS [i]Montpelier[/i] (CL-57) in [[Azur Lane]]. Character design by [[Huanxiang Heitu]], voiced by [[Takahashi Rie]].

In-game, she has [[very long hair|very long]] silvery-[[grey hair]] with [[hair flaps|flaps]], and [[red eyes]]. She also wears a [[white cape]] like her sisters [[Cleveland (Azur Lane)|]] and [[Birmingham (Azur Lane)|]], a [[black shirt]] partially hidden by the cape and a red [[armband]] on the left sleeve, and black [[thighhighs]] with her name printed on it.

Her [[rigging]] is the standard [i]Cleveland[/i]-class battle rig, with two 15.2 cm triple mounts on one side and two 12.7 twin mounts on the other, with two 20 mm Oerlikon AA guns on the side below the 15.2 cm mounts.

She is often depicted with three particular sister ships: Cleveland, Columbia, and Denver. They are called in-game as the "Solomon Knights" and were known as Cruiser Division 12 (CruDiv12) in real life. Montpelier is also SR (SSR in the JP and CN servers) rarity, the first in the class, as she was historically the CruDiv's flagship.

title: birmingham_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the US Navy light cruiser USS [i]Birmingham[/i] (CL-62). Character design by [[Pavapo]], voiced by Watabe Sayumi.

In-game, she has [[short hair with long locks]], colored [[red hair|red]], with matching [[red eyes]]. She wears a [[white cloak]] like her sister [[Montpelier (Azur Lane)|]], and beneath that is a [[blue dress]] with [[black gloves]] and [[thighhighs]]. She also sports a [[blue hairband]] with an [[anchor hair ornament]].

Her rigging is the standard [i]Cleveland[/i]-class setup with the 15.2 cm triple mounts on one side and 12.7 cm twin mounts on the other.

Sometimes paired with Princeton for historical reasons: the battle of Leyte Gulf where she, alongside [[Reno (Azur Lane)|]], stood by the stricken carrier [[Princeton (Azur Lane)|]] and took on her survivors.
